entry.name: @bottom-center
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the bottom margin, centered on the page area, and between the bottom-left and bottom-right margin boxes.

entry.name: @bottom-left
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the bottom margin and adjoining the bottom-left-corner margin box.

entry.name: @bottom-left-corner
entry.desc: A box filling the area defined by the intersection of the bottom and left margins of the page box.

entry.name: @bottom-right
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the bottom margin and adjoining the bottom-right corner margin box.

entry.name: @bottom-right-corner
entry.desc: A box filling the area defined by the intersection of the bottom and right margins of the page box.

entry.name: @charset
entry.desc: Defines character set of the document.

entry.name: @counter-style
entry.desc: Defines a custom counter style.

entry.name: @custom-media
entry.desc: Defines a custom media feature that can then be used in a media feature.

entry.name: @font-face
entry.desc: Allows for linking to fonts that are automatically activated when needed. This permits authors to work around the limitation of 'web-safe' fonts, allowing for consistent rendering independent of the fonts available in a given user's environment.

entry.name: @font-feature-values
entry.desc: Defines named values for the indices used to select alternate glyphs for a given font family.

entry.name: @import
entry.desc: Includes content of another file.

entry.name: @keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: @left-bottom
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the left margin and adjacent to the top of the bottom-left-corner.

entry.name: @left-middle
entry.desc: A variable-height box in the area defined by the left margin, centered on the page area, and between the left-top and left-bottom margin boxes.

entry.name: @left-top
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the left margin and adjacent to the bottom of the top-left-corner.

entry.name: @media
entry.desc: Defines a stylesheet for a particular media type.

entry.name: @-moz-document
entry.desc: Gecko-specific at-rule that restricts the style rules contained within it based on the URL of the document.

entry.name: @-moz-keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: @-ms-viewport
entry.desc: Specifies the size, zoom factor, and orientation of the viewport.

entry.name: @namespace
entry.desc: Declares a prefix and associates it with a namespace name.

entry.name: @-o-keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: @-o-viewport
entry.desc: Specifies the size, zoom factor, and orientation of the viewport.

entry.name: @page
entry.desc: Directive defines various page parameters.

entry.name: @right-bottom
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the right margin and adjacent to the top of the bottom-right-corner.

entry.name: @right-middle
entry.desc: A variable-height box in the area defined by the right margin, centered on the page area, and between the right-top and right-bottom margin boxes.

entry.name: @right-top
entry.desc: A variable-height box within the area defined by the right margin and adjacent to the bottom of the top-right-corner.

entry.name: @scope
entry.desc: Creates scoped style rules using CSS syntax.

entry.name: @supports
entry.desc: A conditional group rule whose condition tests whether the user agent supports CSS property:value pairs.

entry.name: @top-center
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the top margin, centered on the page area, and between the top-left and top-right margin boxes.

entry.name: @top-left
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the top margin and adjoining the top-left-corner margin box.

entry.name: @top-left-corner
entry.desc: A fixed-size box filling the area defined by the intersection of the top and left margins of the page box.

entry.name: @top-right
entry.desc: A variable-width box within the area defined by the top margin and adjoining the top-right-corner margin box.

entry.name: @top-right-corner
entry.desc: A box filling the area defined by the intersection of the top and right margins of the page box.

entry.name: @viewport
entry.desc: Specifies the size, zoom factor, and orientation of the viewport.

entry.name: @-webkit-keyframes
entry.desc: Defines set of animation key frames.

entry.name: :active
entry.desc: Applies while an element is being activated by the user. For example, between the times the user presses the mouse button and releases it.

entry.name: :any-link
entry.desc: Represents an element that acts as the source anchor of a hyperlink. Applies to both visited and unvisited links.

entry.name: :blank
entry.desc: The same as :empty, except that it additionally matches elements that only contain code points affected by whitespace processing.

entry.name: :checked
entry.desc: Radio and checkbox elements can be toggled by the user. Some menu items are 'checked' when the user selects them. When such elements are toggled 'on' the :checked pseudo-class applies.

entry.name: :corner-present
entry.desc: Non-standard. Indicates whether or not a scrollbar corner is present.

entry.name: :current
entry.desc: Represents the element, or an ancestor of the element, that is currently being displayed.

entry.name: :current()
entry.desc: Takes a list of compound selectors as its argument: it represents the :current element that matches the argument or, if that does not match, the innermost ancestor of the :current element that does.

entry.name: :decrement
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to buttons and track pieces. Indicates whether or not the button or track piece will decrement the view’s position when used.

entry.name: :default
entry.desc: Applies to the one or more UI elements that are the default among a set of similar elements. Typically applies to context menu items, buttons, and select lists/menus.

entry.name: :dir()
entry.desc: Represents an element based on its directionality as determined by the document language.

entry.name: :disabled
entry.desc: Represents user interface elements that are in a disabled state; such elements have a corresponding enabled state.

entry.name: :double-button
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to buttons and track pieces. Applies when both buttons are displayed together at the same end of the scrollbar.

entry.name: :empty
entry.desc: Represents an element that has no children at all.

entry.name: :enabled
entry.desc: Represents user interface elements that are in an enabled state; such elements have a corresponding disabled state.

entry.name: :end
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to buttons and track pieces. Indicates whether the object is placed after the thumb.

entry.name: :first
entry.desc: When printing double-sided documents, the page boxes on left and right pages may be different. This can be expressed through CSS pseudo-classes defined in the page context.

entry.name: :first-child
entry.desc: Same as :nth-child(1). Represents an element that is the first child of some other element.

entry.name: :first-of-type
entry.desc: Same as :nth-of-type(1). Represents an element that is the first sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

entry.name: :focus
entry.desc: Applies while an element has the focus (accepts keyboard or mouse events, or other forms of input).

entry.name: :fullscreen
entry.desc: Matches any element that has its fullscreen flag set.

entry.name: :future
entry.desc: Represents any element that is defined to occur entirely after a :current element.

entry.name: :horizontal
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to any scrollbar pieces that have a horizontal orientation.

entry.name: :host
entry.desc: When evaluated in the context of a shadow tree, matches the shadow tree’s host element.

entry.name: :host()
entry.desc: When evaluated in the context of a shadow tree, it matches the shadow tree’s host element if the host element, in its normal context, matches the selector argument.

entry.name: :host-context()
entry.desc: Tests whether there is an ancestor, outside the shadow tree, which matches a particular selector.

entry.name: :hover
entry.desc: Applies while the user designates an element with a pointing device, but does not necessarily activate it. For example, a visual user agent could apply this pseudo-class when the cursor (mouse pointer) hovers over a box generated by the element.

entry.name: :increment
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to buttons and track pieces. Indicates whether or not the button or track piece will increment the view’s position when used.

entry.name: :indeterminate
entry.desc: Applies to UI elements whose value is in an indeterminate state.

entry.name: :in-range
entry.desc: Used in conjunction with the min and max attributes, whether on a range input, a number field, or any other types that accept those attributes.

entry.name: :invalid
entry.desc: An element is :valid or :invalid when it is, respectively, valid or invalid with respect to data validity semantics defined by a different specification.

entry.name: :lang()
entry.desc: Represents an element that is in language specified.

entry.name: :last-child
entry.desc: Same as :nth-last-child(1). Represents an element that is the last child of some other element.

entry.name: :last-of-type
entry.desc: Same as :nth-last-of-type(1). Represents an element that is the last sibling of its type in the list of children of its parent element.

entry.name: :left
entry.desc: When printing double-sided documents, the page boxes on left and right pages may be different. This can be expressed through CSS pseudo-classes defined in the page context.

entry.name: :link
entry.desc: Applies to links that have not yet been visited.

entry.name: :local-link
entry.desc: Allows authors to style hyperlinks based on the users current location within a site and to differentiate site-internal versus site-external links.

entry.name: :local-link()
entry.desc: Accepts a non-negative integer as its sole argument, which, if the document's URL belongs to a hierarchical scheme, indicates the number of path levels to match. Use :local-link(0) to match links that target the same domain.

entry.name: :matches()
entry.desc: Takes a selector list as its argument. It represents an element that is represented by its argument.

entry.name: :-moz-any()
entry.desc: Represents an element that is represented by the selector list passed as its argument. Standardized as :matches().

entry.name: :-moz-any-link
entry.desc: Represents an element that acts as the source anchor of a hyperlink. Applies to both visited and unvisited links.

entry.name: :-moz-broken
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches elements representing broken images.

entry.name: :-moz-drag-over
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches elements when a drag-over event applies to it.

entry.name: :-moz-first-node
entry.desc: Non-standard. Represents an element that is the first child node of some other element.

entry.name: :-moz-focusring
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches an element that has focus and focus ring drawing is enabled in the browser.

entry.name: :-moz-full-screen
entry.desc: Matches any element that has its fullscreen flag set. Standardized as :fullscreen.

entry.name: :-moz-last-node
entry.desc: Non-standard. Represents an element that is the last child node of some other element.

entry.name: :-moz-loading
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches elements, such as images, that haven’t started loading yet.

entry.name: :-moz-only-whitespace
entry.desc: The same as :empty, except that it additionally matches elements that only contain code points affected by whitespace processing. Standardized as :blank.

entry.name: :-moz-placeholder
entry.desc: Deprecated. Represents placeholder text in an input field. Use ::-moz-placeholder for Firefox 19+.

entry.name: :-moz-submit-invalid
entry.desc: Non-standard. Represents any submit button when the contents of the associated form are not valid.

entry.name: :-moz-suppressed
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches elements representing images that have been blocked from loading.

entry.name: :-moz-ui-invalid
entry.desc: Non-standard. Represents any validated form element whose value isn't valid

entry.name: :-moz-ui-valid
entry.desc: Non-standard. Represents any validated form element whose value is valid

entry.name: :-moz-user-disabled
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches elements representing images that have been disabled due to the user’s preferences.

entry.name: :-moz-window-inactive
entry.desc: Non-standard. Matches elements in an inactive window.

entry.name: :-ms-fullscreen
entry.desc: Matches any element that has its fullscreen flag set.

entry.name: :-ms-input-placeholder
entry.desc: Represents placeholder text in an input field. Note: for Edge use the pseudo-element ::-ms-input-placeholder. Standardized as ::placeholder.

entry.name: :-ms-keyboard-active
entry.desc: Windows Store apps only. Applies one or more styles to an element when it has focus and the user presses the space bar.

entry.name: :-ms-lang()
entry.desc: Represents an element that is in the language specified. Accepts a comma seperated list of language tokens.

entry.name: :no-button
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to track pieces. Applies when there is no button at that end of the track.

entry.name: :not()
entry.desc: The negation pseudo-class, :not(X), is a functional notation taking a simple selector (excluding the negation pseudo-class itself) as an argument. It represents an element that is not represented by its argument.

entry.name: :nth-child()
entry.desc: Represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings before it in the document tree, for any positive integer or zero value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :nth-column()
entry.desc: Represents a cell element belonging to a column that has An+B-1 columns before it, for any positive integer or zero value of n.

entry.name: :nth-last-child()
entry.desc: Represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings after it in the document tree, for any positive integer or zero value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :nth-last-column()
entry.desc: Represents a cell element belonging to a column that has An+B-1 columns after it, for any positive integer or zero value of n.

entry.name: :nth-last-match()
entry.desc: Represents an element that has An+B-1 siblings that match the given selector list after it in the document tree.

entry.name: :nth-last-of-type()
entry.desc: Represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same expanded element name after it in the document tree, for any zero or positive integer value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :nth-match()
entry.desc: Represents an element that has An+B-1 siblings that match the given selector list before it in the document tree.

entry.name: :nth-of-type()
entry.desc: Represents an element that has an+b-1 siblings with the same expanded element name before it in the document tree, for any zero or positive integer value of n, and has a parent element.

entry.name: :only-child
entry.desc: Represents an element that has a parent element and whose parent element has no other element children. Same as :first-child:last-child or :nth-child(1):nth-last-child(1), but with a lower specificity.

entry.name: :only-of-type
entry.desc: Matches every element that is the only child of its type, of its parent. Same as :first-of-type:last-of-type or :nth-of-type(1):nth-last-of-type(1), but with a lower specificity.

entry.name: :optional
entry.desc: A form element is :required or :optional if a value for it is, respectively, required or optional before the form it belongs to is submitted. Elements that are not form elements are neither required nor optional.

entry.name: :out-of-range
entry.desc: Used in conjunction with the min and max attributes, whether on a range input, a number field, or any other types that accept those attributes.

entry.name: :past
entry.desc: Represents any element that is defined to occur entirely prior to a :current element.

entry.name: :placeholder-shown
entry.desc: Matches an input element that is showing placeholder text.

entry.name: :read-only
entry.desc: An element whose contents are not user-alterable is :read-only. However, elements whose contents are user-alterable (such as text input fields) are considered to be in a :read-write state. In typical documents, most elements are :read-only.

entry.name: :read-write
entry.desc: An element whose contents are not user-alterable is :read-only. However, elements whose contents are user-alterable (such as text input fields) are considered to be in a :read-write state. In typical documents, most elements are :read-only.

entry.name: :required
entry.desc: A form element is :required or :optional if a value for it is, respectively, required or optional before the form it belongs to is submitted. Elements that are not form elements are neither required nor optional.

entry.name: :recto
entry.desc: Equivalent to ':right' in left-to-right page progressions and ':left' in right-to-left page progressions.

entry.name: :right
entry.desc: When printing double-sided documents, the page boxes on left and right pages may be different. This can be expressed through CSS pseudo-classes defined in the page context.

entry.name: :root
entry.desc: Represents an element that is the root of the document. In HTML 4, this is always the HTML element.

entry.name: :scope
entry.desc: Represents any element that is in the contextual reference element set.

entry.name: :single-button
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to buttons and track pieces. Applies when both buttons are displayed separately at either end of the scrollbar.

entry.name: :start
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to buttons and track pieces. Indicates whether the object is placed before the thumb.

entry.name: :target
entry.desc: Some URIs refer to a location within a resource. This kind of URI ends with a 'number sign' (#) followed by an anchor identifier (called the fragment identifier).

entry.name: :user-invalid
entry.desc: Represents an input element with incorrect input, but only after the user has significantly interacted with it.

entry.name: :valid
entry.desc: An element is :valid or :invalid when it is, respectively, valid or invalid with respect to data validity semantics defined by a different specification.

entry.name: :verso
entry.desc: Equivalent to ':left' in left-to-right page progressions and ':right' in right-to-left page progressions.

entry.name: :vertical
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to any scrollbar pieces that have a vertical orientation.

entry.name: :visited
entry.desc: Applies once the link has been visited by the user.

entry.name: :-webkit-any()
entry.desc: Represents an element that is represented by the selector list passed as its argument. Standardized as :matches().

entry.name: :-webkit-full-screen
entry.desc: Matches any element that has its fullscreen flag set. Standardized as :fullscreen.

entry.name: :window-inactive
entry.desc: Non-standard. Applies to all scrollbar pieces. Indicates whether or not the window containing the scrollbar is currently active.

entry.name: ::after
entry.desc: Represents a styleable child pseudo-element immediately after the originating element’s actual content.

entry.name: ::backdrop
entry.desc: Used to create a backdrop that hides the underlying document for an element in a top layer (such as an element that is displayed fullscreen).

entry.name: ::before
entry.desc: Represents a styleable child pseudo-element immediately before the originating element’s actual content.

entry.name: ::content
entry.desc: Deprecated. Matches the distribution list itself, on elements that have one. Use ::slotted for forward compatibility.

entry.name: ::first-letter
entry.desc: Represents the first letter of an element, if it is not preceded by any other content (such as images or inline tables) on its line.

entry.name: ::first-line
entry.desc: Describes the contents of the first formatted line of its originating element.

entry.name: ::grammar-error
entry.desc: Represents a portion of text that has been flagged by the user agent as misspelled.

entry.name: ::marker
entry.desc: Generated by list items to represent the item’s marker.

entry.name: ::-moz-list-bullet
entry.desc: Used to style the bullet of a list element. Similar to the standardized ::marker.

entry.name: ::-moz-list-number
entry.desc: Used to style the numbers of a list element. Similar to the standardized ::marker.

entry.name: ::-moz-placeholder
entry.desc: Represents placeholder text in an input field

entry.name: ::-moz-progress-bar
entry.desc: Represents the bar portion of a progress bar.

entry.name: ::-moz-selection
entry.desc: Represents the portion of a document that has been highlighted by the user.

entry.name: ::-ms-backdrop
entry.desc: Used to create a backdrop that hides the underlying document for an element in a top layer (such as an element that is displayed fullscreen).

entry.name: ::-ms-browse
entry.desc: Represents the browse button of an input type=file control.

entry.name: ::-ms-check
entry.desc: Represents the check of a checkbox or radio button input control.

entry.name: ::-ms-clear
entry.desc: Represents the clear button of a text input control

entry.name: ::-ms-expand
entry.desc: Represents the drop-down button of a select control.

entry.name: ::-ms-fill
entry.desc: Represents the bar portion of a progress bar.

entry.name: ::-ms-fill-lower
entry.desc: Represents the portion of the slider track from its smallest value up to the value currently selected by the thumb. In a left-to-right layout, this is the portion of the slider track to the left of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-fill-upper
entry.desc: Represents the portion of the slider track from the value currently selected by the thumb up to the slider's largest value. In a left-to-right layout, this is the portion of the slider track to the right of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-reveal
entry.desc: Represents the password reveal button of an input type=password control.

entry.name: ::-ms-thumb
entry.desc: Represents the portion of range input control (also known as a slider control) that the user drags.

entry.name: ::-ms-ticks-after
entry.desc: Represents the tick marks of a slider that begin just after the thumb and continue up to the slider's largest value. In a left-to-right layout, these are the ticks to the right of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-ticks-before
entry.desc: Represents the tick marks of a slider that represent its smallest values up to the value currently selected by the thumb. In a left-to-right layout, these are the ticks to the left of the thumb.

entry.name: ::-ms-tooltip
entry.desc: Represents the tooltip of a slider (input type=range).

entry.name: ::-ms-track
entry.desc: Represents the track of a slider.

entry.name: ::-ms-value
entry.desc: Represents the content of a text or password input control, or a select control.

entry.name: ::placeholder
entry.desc: Represents placeholder text in an input field

entry.name: ::selection
entry.desc: Represents the portion of a document that has been highlighted by the user.

entry.name: ::region
entry.desc: Represents a relationship between a selector that matches a CSS Region, and a relative selector that matches some named flow content.

entry.name: ::shadow
entry.desc: Matches the shadow root if an element has a shadow tree.

entry.name: ::slotted
entry.desc: Matches the distribution list itself, on elements that have one.

entry.name: ::spelling-error
entry.desc: Represents a portion of text that has been flagged by the user agent as misspelled.

entry.name: additive-symbols
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies the symbols used by the marker-construction algorithm specified by the system descriptor. Needs to be specified if the counter system is 'additive'.

entry.name: align-content
entry.desc: Aligns a flex container’s lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how 'justify-content' aligns individual items within the main-axis.

value.name: center
value.desc: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.

value.name: space-around
value.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.

value.name: space-between
value.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.

entry.name: align-items
entry.desc: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

value.name: center
value.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

entry.name: alignment-baseline
entry.desc: Specifies what point of an inline-level box is aligned to what point in the parent.

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: Match the box’s alphabetic baseline to that of its parent.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: Use the dominant baseline choice of the parent. Match the box’s corresponding baseline to that of its parent.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Align the bottom of the aligned subtree with the bottom of the line box.

value.name: center
value.desc: Align the center of the aligned subtree with the center of the line box.

value.name: central
value.desc: Match the box’s central baseline to the central baseline of its parent.

value.name: mathematical
value.desc: Match the box’s mathematical baseline to that of its parent.

value.name: middle
value.desc: Align the vertical midpoint of the box with the baseline of the parent box plus half the x-height of the parent.

value.name: text-bottom
value.desc: Match the bottom of the box to the bottom of the parent’s content area.

value.name: text-top
value.desc: Match the top of the box to the top of the parent’s content area.

value.name: top
value.desc: Align the top of the aligned subtree with the top of the line box.

entry.name: align-self
entry.desc: Allows the default alignment along the cross axis to be overridden for individual flex items.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element’s parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

value.name: center
value.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

entry.name: all
entry.desc: Shorthand that resets all properties except 'direction' and 'unicode-bidi'.

value.name: revert
value.desc: Behavior depends on the origin to which the declaration belongs.

entry.name: alt
entry.desc: Provides alternative text for assistive technology to replace the genenerated content of a ::before or ::after element.

value.name: none
value.desc: No alternative text.

entry.name: animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: animation-composition
entry.desc: Defines the composite operation used when multiple animations affect the same property simultaneously.

value.name: accumulate
value.desc: The effect value is accumulated onto the underlying value.

value.name: add
value.desc: The effect value is added to the underlying value.

value.name: replace
value.desc: The result of compositing the effect value with the underlying value is simply the effect value.

entry.name: animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

entry.name: animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: animation-fill-mode
entry.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

entry.name: animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration.

entry.name: backdrop-filter
entry.desc: Applies a filter effect where the first filter in the list takes the element's background image as the input image.

value.name: none
value.desc: No filter effects are applied.

value.name: blur()
value.desc: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

value.name: brightness()
value.desc: Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.

value.name: contrast()
value.desc: Adjusts the contrast of the input.

value.name: drop-shadow()
value.desc: Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.

value.name: grayscale()
value.desc: Converts the input image to grayscale.

value.name: hue-rotate()
value.desc: Applies a hue rotation on the input image.

value.name: invert()
value.desc: Inverts the samples in the input image.

value.name: opacity()
value.desc: Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.

value.name: saturate()
value.desc: Saturates the input image.

value.name: sepia()
value.desc: Converts the input image to sepia.

value.name: url()
value.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

entry.name: backface-visibility
entry.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Back side is hidden.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Back side is visible.

entry.name: background
entry.restriction: enum, image, color, position, length, repeat, percentage, box
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting most background properties at the same place in the style sheet.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

value.name: local
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element's contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element's contents.

value.name: none
value.desc: A value of 'none' counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element's border.)

entry.name: background-attachment
entry.desc: Specifies whether the background images are fixed with regard to the viewport ('fixed') or scroll along with the element ('scroll') or its contents ('local').

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the viewport. In paged media where there is no viewport, a 'fixed' background is fixed with respect to the page box and therefore replicated on every page.

value.name: local
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element’s contents: if the element has a scrolling mechanism, the background scrolls with the element’s contents.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: The background is fixed with regard to the element itself and does not scroll with its contents. (It is effectively attached to the element’s border.)

entry.name: background-blend-mode
entry.desc: Defines the blending mode of each background layer.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Default attribute which specifies no blending

value.name: multiply
value.desc: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.

value.name: screen
value.desc: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

value.name: overlay
value.desc: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.

value.name: darken
value.desc: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

value.name: lighten
value.desc: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

value.name: color-dodge
value.desc: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

value.name: color-burn
value.desc: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

value.name: hard-light
value.desc: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.

value.name: soft-light
value.desc: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.

value.name: difference
value.desc: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color..

value.name: exclusion
value.desc: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.

value.name: hue
value.desc: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

value.name: saturation
value.desc: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.

value.name: color
value.desc: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.

value.name: luminosity
value.desc: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.

entry.name: background-clip
entry.desc: Determines the background painting area.

entry.name: background-color
entry.desc: Sets the background color of an element.

entry.name: background-image
entry.desc: Sets the background image(s) of an element.

value.name: none
value.desc: Counts as an image layer but draws nothing.

entry.name: background-image-transform
entry.desc: Defines whether background images are transformed to match to the value of 'writing-mode' property, and whether 'background-size' widths and heights are logical or physical.

value.name: logical
value.desc: The values for the 'background-size' property are logical. The background images are transformed to match to the logical axis.

value.name: physical
value.desc: The values for the 'background-size' property are physical. The background images remain unchanged.

value.name: rotate
value.desc: Similar to logical, except that the inline direction is ignored.

entry.name: background-origin
entry.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

entry.name: background-position
entry.desc: Specifies the initial position of the background image(s) (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

entry.name: background-position-x
entry.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: left
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the left edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: right
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the horizontal position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the right edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: background-position-y
entry.desc: If background images have been specified, this property specifies their initial position (after any resizing) within their corresponding background positioning area.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Equivalent to '100%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the bottom edge as the origin for the next offset.

value.name: center
value.desc: Equivalent to '50%' ('left 50%') for the horizontal position if the horizontal position is not otherwise specified, or '50%' ('top 50%') for the vertical position if it is.

value.name: top
value.desc: Equivalent to '0%' for the vertical position if one or two values are given, otherwise specifies the top edge as the origin for the next offset.

entry.name: background-repeat
entry.desc: Specifies how background images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Double values are considered logical.

entry.name: background-size
entry.desc: Specifies the size of the background images.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Resolved by using the image’s intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image’s intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

value.name: contain
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

value.name: cover
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

entry.name: baseline-shift
entry.desc: Specifies by how much the box is shifted up from its alignment point.

value.name: sub
value.desc: Lower by the offset appropriate for subscripts of the parent’s box.

value.name: super
value.desc: Raise by the offset appropriate for superscripts of the parent’s box.

entry.name: behavior
entry.desc: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser.

entry.name: block-size
entry.desc: Logical 'width'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: border
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting border width, style, and color.

entry.name: border-block-end
entry.desc: Logical 'border-bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-start
entry.desc: Logical 'border-top'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-end-color
entry.desc: Logical 'border-bottom-color'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-start-color
entry.desc: Logical 'border-top-color'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-end-style
entry.desc: Logical 'border-bottom-style'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-start-style
entry.desc: Logical 'border-top-style'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-end-width
entry.desc: Logical 'border-bottom-width'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-block-start-width
entry.desc: Logical 'border-top-width'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color.

entry.name: border-bottom-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the bottom border.

entry.name: border-bottom-left-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the bottom left outer border edge.

entry.name: border-bottom-right-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the bottom right outer border edge.

entry.name: border-bottom-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the bottom border.

entry.name: border-bottom-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the bottom border.

entry.name: border-collapse
entry.desc: Selects a table's border model.

value.name: collapse
value.desc: Selects the collapsing borders model.

value.name: separate
value.desc: Selects the separated borders border model.

entry.name: border-color
entry.desc: The color of the border around all four edges of an element.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

value.name: none
value.desc: Use the border styles.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: border-image-outset
entry.desc: The values specify the amount by which the border image area extends beyond the border box on the top, right, bottom, and left sides respectively. If the fourth value is absent, it is the same as the second. If the third one is also absent, it is the same as the first. If the second one is also absent, it is the same as the first. Numbers represent multiples of the corresponding border-width.

entry.name: border-image-repeat
entry.desc: Specifies how the images for the sides and the middle part of the border image are scaled and tiled. If the second keyword is absent, it is assumed to be the same as the first.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: border-image-slice
entry.desc: Specifies inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the image, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

entry.name: border-image-source
entry.desc: Specifies an image to use instead of the border styles given by the 'border-style' properties and as an additional background layer for the element. If the value is 'none' or if the image cannot be displayed, the border styles will be used.

value.name: none
value.desc: Use the border styles.

entry.name: border-image-transform
entry.desc: Defines whether border images are transformed to match to the value of 'writing-mode' property.

value.name: logical
value.desc: The values for the 'border-image' properties are logical. The border images are transformed to match to the logical axis.

value.name: physical
value.desc: The values for the 'border-image' properties are physical. The border images remain unchanged.

value.name: rotate
value.desc: Similar to 'logical', except that the inline direction is ignored.

entry.name: border-image-width
entry.desc: The four values of 'border-image-width' specify offsets that are used to divide the border image area into nine parts. They represent inward distances from the top, right, bottom, and left sides of the area, respectively.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

entry.name: border-inline-end
entry.desc: Logical 'border-right'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-start
entry.desc: Logical 'border-left'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-end-color
entry.desc: Logical 'border-right-color'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-start-color
entry.desc: Logical 'border-left-color'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-end-style
entry.desc: Logical 'border-right-style'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-start-style
entry.desc: Logical 'border-left-style'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-end-width
entry.desc: Logical 'border-right-width'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-inline-start-width
entry.desc: Logical 'border-left-width'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: border-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

entry.name: border-left-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the left border.

entry.name: border-left-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the left border.

entry.name: border-left-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the left border.

entry.name: border-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the outer border edge.

entry.name: border-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

entry.name: border-right-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the right border.

entry.name: border-right-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the right border.

entry.name: border-right-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the right border.

entry.name: border-spacing
entry.desc: The lengths specify the distance that separates adjoining cell borders. If one length is specified, it gives both the horizontal and vertical spacing. If two are specified, the first gives the horizontal spacing and the second the vertical spacing. Lengths may not be negative.

entry.name: border-style
entry.desc: The style of the border around edges of an element.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: border-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting border width, style and color

entry.name: border-top-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the top border.

entry.name: border-top-left-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the top left outer border edge.

entry.name: border-top-right-radius
entry.desc: Defines the radii of the top right outer border edge.

entry.name: border-top-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the top border.

entry.name: border-top-width
entry.desc: Sets the thickness of the top border.

entry.name: border-width
entry.desc: Shorthand that sets the four 'border-*-width' properties. If it has four values, they set top, right, bottom and left in that order. If left is missing, it is the same as right; if bottom is missing, it is the same as top; if right is missing, it is the same as top.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: bottom
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's bottom margin edge is offset above the bottom edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: box-decoration-break
entry.desc: Specifies whether individual boxes are treated as broken pieces of one continuous box, or whether each box is individually wrapped with the border and padding.

value.name: clone
value.desc: Each box is independently wrapped with the border and padding.

value.name: slice
value.desc: The effect is as though the element were rendered with no breaks present, and then sliced by the breaks afterward.

entry.name: box-shadow
entry.desc: Attaches one or more drop-shadows to the box. The property is a comma-separated list of shadows, each specified by 2-4 length values, an optional color, and an optional 'inset' keyword. Omitted lengths are 0; omitted colors are a user agent chosen color.

value.name: inset
value.desc: Changes the drop shadow from an outer shadow (one that shadows the box onto the canvas, as if it were lifted above the canvas) to an inner shadow (one that shadows the canvas onto the box, as if the box were cut out of the canvas and shifted behind it).

value.name: none
value.desc: No shadow.

entry.name: box-sizing
entry.desc: Specifies the behavior of the 'width' and 'height' properties.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

entry.name: box-snap
entry.desc: Specifies how the block is snapped to the baseline grid.

value.name: none
value.desc: The block is not snapped to any grid.

value.name: block-start
value.desc: The block-start edge is snapped to the nearest grid line.

value.name: block-end
value.desc: The block-end edge is snapped to the nearest grid line.

value.name: center
value.desc: The block is centered centered between one of the baseline grid’s text-over baselines and a subsequent (but not necessarily consecutive) text-under baseline.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: The first line box’s dominant baseline is snapped to the nearest grid line.

value.name: last-baseline
value.desc: The last line box’s dominant baseline is snapped to the nearest grid line.

entry.name: box-suppress
entry.desc: Toggles whether or not an element appears in the formatting tree without affecting its display type when it is displayed.

value.name: show
value.desc: The element generates boxes as normal, per its 'display-*' properties.

value.name: discard
value.desc: The element generates no boxes at all.

value.name: hide
value.desc: The element generates boxes as normal, but those boxes do not participate in layout in any way.

entry.name: break-after
entry.desc: Describes the page/column/region break behavior after the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid-region
value.desc: Avoid a region break before/after the principal box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the principal box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the principal box.

value.name: region
value.desc: Always force a region break before/after the principal box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

value.name: recto
value.desc: Forces a page break so that the next page is formatted as the right page in ltr langages or the left page for rtl.

value.name: verso
value.desc: Forces a page break so that the next page is formatted as the left page in ltr langages or the right page for rtl.

entry.name: break-before
entry.desc: Describes the page/column/region break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the principal box.

value.name: avoid-region
value.desc: Avoid a region break before/after the principal box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the principal box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the principal box.

value.name: region
value.desc: Always force a region break before/after the principal box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

value.name: recto
value.desc: Forces a page break so that the next page is formatted as the right page in ltr langages or the left page for rtl.

value.name: verso
value.desc: Forces a page break so that the next page is formatted as the left page in ltr langages or the right page for rtl.

entry.name: break-inside
entry.desc: Describes the page/column/region break behavior inside the principal box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Impose no additional breaking constraints within the box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid breaks within the box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break within the box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break within the box.

value.name: avoid-region
value.desc: Avoid a region break within the box.

entry.name: caption-side
entry.desc: Specifies the position of the caption box with respect to the table box.

value.name: block-end
value.desc: Logical 'bottom'

value.name: block-start
value.desc: Logical 'top'

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Positions the caption box below the table box.

value.name: inline-end
value.desc: Logical 'right'

value.name: inline-start
value.desc: Logical 'left'

value.name: top
value.desc: Positions the caption box above the table box.

entry.name: caret-color
entry.desc: Controls the color of the text insertion indicator.

value.name: auto
value.desc: currentColor. User agents may automatically adjust the color of caret to ensure good visibility and contrast with the surrounding content.

entry.name: clear
entry.desc: Indicates which sides of an element's box(es) may not be adjacent to an earlier floating box. The 'clear' property does not consider floats inside the element itself or in other block formatting contexts.

value.name: both
value.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating and left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

value.name: inline-end
value.desc: Logical 'right'

value.name: inline-start
value.desc: Logical 'left'

value.name: left
value.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any left-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

value.name: none
value.desc: No constraint on the box's position with respect to floats.

value.name: right
value.desc: The clearance of the generated box is set to the amount necessary to place the top border edge below the bottom outer edge of any right-floating boxes that resulted from elements earlier in the source document.

entry.name: clip
entry.desc: Deprecated. Use the 'clip-path' property when support allows. Defines the visible portion of an element’s box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element does not clip.

value.name: rect()
value.desc: Specifies offsets from the edges of the border box.

entry.name: clip-path
entry.desc: Specifies a clipping path where everything inside the path is visable and everything outside is clipped out.

value.name: none
value.desc: No clipping path gets created.

value.name: url()
value.desc: References a <clipPath> element to create a clipping path.

entry.name: clip-rule
entry.desc: Indicates the algorithm which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

value.name: evenodd
value.desc: Determines the ‘insideness’ of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

value.name: nonzero
value.desc: Determines the ‘insideness’ of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

entry.name: color
entry.desc: Color of an element's text

entry.name: color-adjust
entry.desc: Provides a hint to the user-agent about how it should treat color and style choices that might be expensive or generally unwise on a given device.

value.name: economy
value.desc: The user agent should make adjustments to the page’s styling as it deems necessary and prudent for the output device.

value.name: exact
value.desc: Indicates that the page is using color and styling on the specified element in a way which is important and significant, and which should not be tweaked or changed except at the user’s request.

entry.name: color-interpolation
entry.desc: Specifies the color space for gradient interpolations, color animations and alpha compositing.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Color operations are not required to occur in a particular color space.

value.name: linearRGB
value.desc: Color operations should occur in the linearized RGB color space.

value.name: sRGB
value.desc: Color operations should occur in the sRGB color space.

entry.name: color-interpolation-filters
entry.desc: Specifies the color space for imaging operations performed via filter effects.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Color operations are not required to occur in a particular color space.

value.name: linearRGB
value.desc: Color operations should occur in the linearized RGB color space.

value.name: sRGB
value.desc: Color operations should occur in the sRGB color space.

entry.name: color-rendering
entry.desc: Provides a hint about how to optimize its color interpolation and compositing operations.

value.name: optimizeQuality
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize quality over rendering speed.

value.name: optimizeSpeed
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize rendering speed over quality.

entry.name: column-count
entry.desc: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

entry.name: column-fill
entry.desc: In continuous media, this property will only be consulted if the length of columns has been constrained. Otherwise, columns will automatically be balanced.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Fills columns sequentially.

value.name: balance
value.desc: Balance content equally between columns, if possible.

entry.name: column-gap
entry.desc: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

value.name: normal
value.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

entry.name: column-rule
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

entry.name: column-rule-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the column rule

entry.name: column-rule-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

entry.name: column-rule-width
entry.desc: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

entry.name: columns
entry.desc: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: column-span
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior after the generated box.

value.name: all
value.desc: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element does not span multiple columns.

entry.name: column-width
entry.desc: Describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Specifies the optimal column width as the fill-available inline size of the multi-column element.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Specifies the optimal column width as min(max-content inline size, max(min-content inline size, fill-available inline size)).

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Specifies the optimal column width as the max-content inline size of the multi-column element’s contents.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Specifies the optimal column width as the min-content inline size of the multi-column element’s contents.

entry.name: contain
entry.desc: Indicates that an element and its contents are, as much as possible, independent of the rest of the document tree.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that the property has no effect.

value.name: strict
value.desc: Turns on all forms of containment for the element.

value.name: layout
value.desc: Turns on layout containment for the element.

value.name: style
value.desc: Turns on style containment for the element.

value.name: paint
value.desc: Turns on paint containment for the element.

entry.name: content
entry.desc: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

value.name: attr()
value.desc: The attr(n) function returns as a string the value of attribute n for the subject of the selector.

value.name: box
value.desc: A hollow square.

value.name: check
value.desc: A check mark.

value.name: circle
value.desc: A hollow circle.

value.name: close-quote
value.desc: Value is replaced by the appropriate string from the 'quotes' property.

value.name: contents
value.desc: Displays the element's descendents.

value.name: counter(name)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: counter(name, style)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: counters(name, string)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: counters(name, string, style)
value.desc: Counters are denoted by identifiers (see the 'counter-increment' and 'counter-reset' properties).

value.name: date(format)
value.desc: Current date and/or time, formatted according to the specified formatting string. Format is based on POSIX date formatting strings.

value.name: diamond
value.desc: A filled diamond. On some platforms, this is similar to 'disc'.

value.name: disc
value.desc: A filled circle.

value.name: endnote
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(endnote, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a endnote.

value.name: footnote
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(footnote, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a footnote.

value.name: hyphen
value.desc: A hyphen bullet.

value.name: icon
value.desc: The (pseudo-)element is replaced in its entirety by the resource referenced by its 'icon' property, and treated as a replaced element.

value.name: inhibit
value.desc: On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements, this inhibits the creation of the pseudo-element, as if 'display' computed to 'none'.

value.name: list-item
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(list-item, normal)'. Note that this is not equivalent to 'normal' when set on a '::marker' pseudo-element that has a superior with 'display' set to 'list-item', as it ignores the 'list-style' properties.

value.name: no-close-quote
value.desc: Inserts nothing (as in 'none'), but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

value.name: none
value.desc: On elements, this inhibits the children of the element from being rendered as children of this element, as if the element was empty. On pseudo-elements it causes the pseudo-element to have no content.

value.name: no-open-quote
value.desc: Inserts nothing (as in 'none'), but increments (decrements) the level of nesting for quotes.

value.name: normal
value.desc: See http://www.w3.org/TR/css3-content/#content for computation rules.

value.name: open-quote
value.desc: Value is replaced by the appropriate string from the 'quotes' property.

value.name: pending()
value.desc: This causes all elements and pseudo-elements whose 'move-to' property computes to the specified identifier to be inserted as children of the current element (or pseudo-element).

value.name: section-note
value.desc: Shorthand for 'counter(section-note, normal)'. This is intended to be used on the in-flow part of a section-note.

value.name: square
value.desc: A filled square.

value.name: string(name)
value.desc: Specifies a string value

entry.name: counter-increment
entry.desc: Manipulate the value of existing counters.

value.name: none
value.desc: This element does not alter the value of any counters.

entry.name: counter-reset
entry.desc: Property accepts one or more names of counters (identifiers), each one optionally followed by an integer. The integer gives the value that the counter is set to on each occurrence of the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The counter is not modified.

entry.name: crop
entry.desc: Allows a replaced element to be just a rectangular area of an object, instead of the whole object.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element's computed intrinsic width and height are the same as its actual intrinsic width and height.

value.name: insert-rect(top, right, bottom, left)
value.desc: Each of the four arguments can be a <length> or a <percentage>. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the respective edges of the element.

value.name: rect(top, right, bottom, left)
value.desc: Each of the four arguments can be a <length> or a <percentage>. All percentage values are computed relative to the intrinsic dimensions of the element, if there is one. Values are offsets relative to the top left of the element.

entry.name: cue
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'cue-before' and 'cue-after'. If two values are given the first value is 'cue-before' and the second is 'cue-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

value.name: none
value.desc: No auditory icon is specified.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Designates an auditory icon resource.

entry.name: cue-after
entry.desc: Specifies an auditory icon (i.e. pre-recorded / pre-generated sound clips) to be played after the selected element within the aural box model.

value.name: none
value.desc: No auditory icon is specified.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Designates an auditory icon resource.

entry.name: cue-before
entry.desc: Specifies an auditory icon (i.e. pre-recorded / pre-generated sound clips) to be played before the selected element within the aural box model.

value.name: none
value.desc: No auditory icon is specified.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Designates an auditory icon resource.

entry.name: cursor
entry.desc: Allows control over cursor appearance in an element

value.name: alias
value.desc: Indicates an alias of/shortcut to something is to be created. Often rendered as an arrow with a small curved arrow next to it.

value.name: all-scroll
value.desc: Indicates that the something can be scrolled in any direction. Often rendered as arrows pointing up, down, left, and right with a dot in the middle.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the cursor to display based on the current context.

value.name: cell
value.desc: Indicates that a cell or set of cells may be selected. Often rendered as a thick plus-sign with a dot in the middle.

value.name: col-resize
value.desc: Indicates that the item/column can be resized horizontally. Often rendered as arrows pointing left and right with a vertical bar separating them.

value.name: context-menu
value.desc: A context menu is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as an arrow with a small menu-like graphic next to it.

value.name: copy
value.desc: Indicates something is to be copied. Often rendered as an arrow with a small plus sign next to it.

value.name: crosshair
value.desc: A simple crosshair (e.g., short line segments resembling a '+' sign). Often used to indicate a two dimensional bitmap selection mode.

value.name: default
value.desc: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.

value.name: e-resize
value.desc: Indicates that east edge is to be moved.

value.name: ew-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional east-west resize cursor.

value.name: grab
value.desc: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

value.name: grabbing
value.desc: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

value.name: help
value.desc: Help is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as a question mark or a balloon.

value.name: move
value.desc: Indicates something is to be moved.

value.name: -moz-grab
value.desc: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

value.name: -moz-grabbing
value.desc: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

value.name: -moz-zoom-in
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

value.name: -moz-zoom-out
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

value.name: ne-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from north-east corner.

value.name: nesw-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional north-east/south-west cursor.

value.name: no-drop
value.desc: Indicates that the dragged item cannot be dropped at the current cursor location. Often rendered as a hand or pointer with a small circle with a line through it.

value.name: none
value.desc: No cursor is rendered for the element.

value.name: not-allowed
value.desc: Indicates that the requested action will not be carried out. Often rendered as a circle with a line through it.

value.name: n-resize
value.desc: Indicates that north edge is to be moved.

value.name: ns-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional north-south cursor.

value.name: nw-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from north-west corner.

value.name: nwse-resize
value.desc: Indicates a bidirectional north-west/south-east cursor.

value.name: pointer
value.desc: The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link.

value.name: progress
value.desc: A progress indicator. The program is performing some processing, but is different from 'wait' in that the user may still interact with the program. Often rendered as a spinning beach ball, or an arrow with a watch or hourglass.

value.name: row-resize
value.desc: Indicates that the item/row can be resized vertically. Often rendered as arrows pointing up and down with a horizontal bar separating them.

value.name: se-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from south-east corner.

value.name: s-resize
value.desc: Indicates that south edge is to be moved.

value.name: sw-resize
value.desc: Indicates that movement starts from south-west corner.

value.name: text
value.desc: Indicates text that may be selected. Often rendered as a vertical I-beam.

value.name: vertical-text
value.desc: Indicates vertical-text that may be selected. Often rendered as a horizontal I-beam.

value.name: wait
value.desc: Indicates that the program is busy and the user should wait. Often rendered as a watch or hourglass.

value.name: -webkit-grab
value.desc: Indicates that something can be grabbed.

value.name: -webkit-grabbing
value.desc: Indicates that something is being grabbed.

value.name: -webkit-zoom-in
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

value.name: -webkit-zoom-out
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

value.name: w-resize
value.desc: Indicates that west edge is to be moved.

value.name: zoom-in
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) in.

value.name: zoom-out
value.desc: Indicates that something can be zoomed (magnified) out.

entry.name: cx
entry.desc: Describes the horizontal center coordinate of the position of the element.

entry.name: cy
entry.desc: Describes the vertical center coordinate of the position of the element.

entry.name: direction
entry.desc: Specifies the inline base direction or directionality of any bidi paragraph, embedding, isolate, or override established by the box. Note: for HTML content use the 'dir' attribute and 'bdo' element rather than this property.

value.name: ltr
value.desc: Left-to-right direction.

value.name: rtl
value.desc: Right-to-left direction.

entry.name: display
entry.desc: In combination with 'float' and 'position', determines the type of box or boxes that are generated for an element.

value.name: block
value.desc: The element generates a block-level box

value.name: contents
value.desc: The element itself does not generate any boxes, but its children and pseudo-elements still generate boxes as normal.

value.name: flex
value.desc: The element generates a principal flex container box and establishes a flex formatting context.

value.name: flexbox
value.desc: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

value.name: flow
value.desc: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout).

value.name: flow-root
value.desc: The element generates a block container box, and lays out its contents using flow layout.

value.name: grid
value.desc: The element generates a principal grid container box, and establishes a grid formatting context.

value.name: inline
value.desc: The element generates an inline-level box.

value.name: inline-block
value.desc: A block box, which itself is flowed as a single inline box, similar to a replaced element. The inside of an inline-block is formatted as a block box, and the box itself is formatted as an inline box.

value.name: inline-flex
value.desc: Inline-level flex container.

value.name: inline-flexbox
value.desc: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

value.name: inline-grid
