value.desc: Inline-level grid container.

value.name: inline-table
value.desc: Inline-level table wrapper box containing table box.

value.name: list-item
value.desc: One or more block boxes and one marker box.

value.name: -moz-box
value.desc: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

value.name: -moz-inline-box
value.desc: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

value.name: -ms-flexbox
value.desc: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

value.name: -ms-grid
value.desc: The element generates a principal grid container box, and establishes a grid formatting context.

value.name: -ms-inline-flexbox
value.desc: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

value.name: -ms-inline-grid
value.desc: Inline-level grid container.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element and its descendants generates no boxes.

value.name: ruby
value.desc: The element generates a principal ruby container box, and establishes a ruby formatting context.

value.name: run-in
value.desc: The element generates a run-in box. Run-in elements act like inlines or blocks, depending on the surrounding elements.

value.name: table
value.desc: The element generates a principal table wrapper box containing an additionally-generated table box, and establishes a table formatting context.

value.name: -webkit-box
value.desc: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout). Standardized as 'flex'.

value.name: -webkit-flex
value.desc: The element lays out its contents using flow layout (block-and-inline layout).

value.name: -webkit-inline-box
value.desc: Inline-level flex container. Standardized as 'inline-flex'

value.name: -webkit-inline-flex
value.desc: Inline-level flex container.

entry.name: dominant-baseline
entry.desc: Specifies the dominant baseline, which is the baseline used to align the box’s text and inline-level contents.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Equivalent to 'alphabetic' in horizontal writing modes and in vertical writing modes when 'text-orientation' is 'sideways', 'sideways-right', or 'sideways-left'. equivalent to 'central' in vertical writing modes when 'text-orientation' is 'mixed' or 'upright'.

value.name: text-bottom
value.desc: Use the bottom of the em box as the baseline.

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: Use the alphabetic baseline.

value.name: central
value.desc: Use the central baseline (halfway between the ascent and descent).

value.name: mathematical
value.desc: Use the mathematical baseline.

value.name: hanging
value.desc: Use the hanging baseline.

value.name: text-top
value.desc: Use the top of the em box as the baseline.

entry.name: empty-cells
entry.desc: In the separated borders model, this property controls the rendering of borders and backgrounds around cells that have no visible content.

value.name: hide
value.desc: No borders or backgrounds are drawn around/behind empty cells.

value.name: show
value.desc: Borders and backgrounds are drawn around/behind empty cells (like normal cells).

entry.name: enable-background
entry.desc: Deprecated. Use 'isolation' property instead when support allows. Specifies how the accumulation of the background image is managed.

value.name: accumulate
value.desc: If the ancestor container element has a property of new, then all graphics elements within the current container are rendered both on the parent's background image and onto the target.

value.name: new
value.desc: Create a new background image canvas. All children of the current container element can access the background, and they will be rendered onto both the parent's background image canvas in addition to the target device.

entry.name: fallback
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a fallback counter style to be used when the current counter style can’t create a representation for a given counter value.

entry.name: fill
entry.desc: Paints the interior of the given graphical element.

value.name: child
value.desc: A reference to the last child paint server element of the element being painted.

value.name: child()
value.desc: A reference to the nth child paint server element of the element being painted.

value.name: context-fill
value.desc: The computed value of the ‘fill’ property of the context element of the element being painted.

value.name: context-stroke
value.desc: The computed value of the ‘stroke’ property of the context element of the element being painted.

value.name: url()
value.desc: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: ‘hatch’, ‘linearGradient’, ‘mesh’, ‘pattern’, ‘radialGradient’ and ‘solidcolor’.

value.name: none
value.desc: No paint is applied in this layer.

entry.name: fill-opacity
entry.desc: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to paint the interior the current object.

entry.name: fill-rule
entry.desc: Indicates the algorithm (or winding rule) which is to be used to determine what parts of the canvas are included inside the shape.

value.name: evenodd
value.desc: Determines the ‘insideness’ of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and counting the number of path segments from the given shape that the ray crosses.

value.name: nonzero
value.desc: Determines the ‘insideness’ of a point on the canvas by drawing a ray from that point to infinity in any direction and then examining the places where a segment of the shape crosses the ray.

entry.name: filter
entry.desc: Processes an element’s rendering before it is displayed in the document, by applying one or more filter effects.

value.name: none
value.desc: No filter effects are applied.

value.name: blur()
value.desc: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

value.name: brightness()
value.desc: Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.

value.name: contrast()
value.desc: Adjusts the contrast of the input.

value.name: drop-shadow()
value.desc: Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.

value.name: grayscale()
value.desc: Converts the input image to grayscale.

value.name: hue-rotate()
value.desc: Applies a hue rotation on the input image.

value.name: invert()
value.desc: Inverts the samples in the input image.

value.name: opacity()
value.desc: Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.

value.name: saturate()
value.desc: Saturates the input image.

value.name: sepia()
value.desc: Converts the input image to sepia.

value.name: url()
value.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

entry.name: flex
entry.desc: Specifies the components of a flexible length: the flex grow factor and flex shrink factor, and the flex basis.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

value.name: content
value.desc: Indicates automatic sizing, based on the flex item’s content.

value.name: none
value.desc: Expands to '0 0 auto'.

entry.name: flex-basis
entry.desc: Sets the flex basis.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

value.name: content
value.desc: Indicates automatic sizing, based on the flex item’s content.

entry.name: flex-direction
entry.desc: Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container’s main axis.

value.name: column
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: column-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

value.name: row
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: row-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: flex-flow
entry.desc: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.

value.name: column
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: column-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flex container is single-line.

value.name: row
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: row-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: flex-grow
entry.desc: Sets the flex grow factor. Negative numbers are invalid.

entry.name: flex-shrink
entry.desc: Sets the flex shrink factor. Negative numbers are invalid.

entry.name: flex-wrap
entry.desc: Controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction new lines are stacked in.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flex container is single-line.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: float
entry.desc: Specifies how a box should be floated. It may be set for any element, but only applies to elements that generate boxes that are not absolutely positioned.

value.name: inline-end
value.desc: Logical 'right'

value.name: inline-start
value.desc: Logical 'left'

value.name: left
value.desc: The element generates a block box that is floated to the left. Content flows on the right side of the box, starting at the top (subject to the 'clear' property).

value.name: none
value.desc: The box is not floated.

value.name: right
value.desc: Similar to 'left', except the box is floated to the right, and content flows on the left side of the box, starting at the top.

entry.name: flood-color
entry.desc: Indicates what color to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

entry.name: flood-opacity
entry.desc: Indicates what opacity to use to flood the current filter primitive subregion.

entry.name: flow-from
entry.desc: Makes a block container a region and associates it with a named flow.

value.name: none
value.desc: The block container is not a CSS Region.

entry.name: flow-into
entry.desc: Places an element or its contents into a named flow.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element is not moved to a named flow and normal CSS processing takes place.

entry.name: font
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'font-style', 'font-variant', 'font-weight', 'font-size', 'line-height', and 'font-family', at the same place in the style sheet. The syntax of this property is based on a traditional typographical shorthand notation to set multiple properties related to fonts.

value.desc: Thin
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Light
Normal
Medium
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Bold
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

value.name: bold
value.desc: Same as 700

value.name: bolder
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.

value.name: caption
value.desc: The font used for captioned controls (e.g., buttons, drop-downs, etc.).

value.name: icon
value.desc: The font used to label icons.

value.name: italic
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'italic', or, if that is not available, one labeled 'oblique'.

value.name: lighter
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.

value.name: menu
value.desc: The font used in menus (e.g., dropdown menus and menu lists).

value.name: message-box
value.desc: The font used in dialog boxes.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

value.name: oblique
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled 'oblique'.

value.name: small-caps
value.desc: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

value.name: small-caption
value.desc: The font used for labeling small controls.

value.name: status-bar
value.desc: The font used in window status bars.

entry.name: font-family
entry.desc: Specifies a prioritized list of font family names or generic family names. A user agent iterates through the list of family names until it matches an available font that contains a glyph for the character to be rendered.

value.name: Cambria, Cochin, Georgia, Times, Times New Roman, serif
'Gill Sans', 'Gill Sans MT', Calibri, 'Trebuchet MS', sans-serif
'Lucida Sans', 'Lucida Sans Regular', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', Geneva, Verdana, sans-serif
'Trebuchet MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Lucida Grande', 'Lucida Sans', Arial, sans-serif

entry.name: font-feature-settings
entry.desc: Provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

value.name: "aalt"
value.desc: Access All Alternates.

value.name: "abvf"
value.desc: Above-base Forms. Required in Khmer script.

value.name: "abvm"
value.desc: Above-base Mark Positioning. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "abvs"
value.desc: Above-base Substitutions. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "afrc"
value.desc: Alternative Fractions.

value.name: "akhn"
value.desc: Akhand. Required in most Indic scripts.

value.name: "blwf"
value.desc: Below-base Form. Required in a number of Indic scripts.

value.name: "blwm"
value.desc: Below-base Mark Positioning. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "blws"
value.desc: Below-base Substitutions. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "calt"
value.desc: Contextual Alternates.

value.name: "case"
value.desc: Case-Sensitive Forms. Applies only to European scripts; particularly prominent in Spanish-language setting.

value.name: "ccmp"
value.desc: Glyph Composition/Decomposition.

value.name: "cfar"
value.desc: Conjunct Form After Ro. Required in Khmer scripts.

value.name: "cjct"
value.desc: Conjunct Forms. Required in Indic scripts that show similarity to Devanagari.

value.name: "clig"
value.desc: Contextual Ligatures.

value.name: "cpct"
value.desc: Centered CJK Punctuation. Used primarily in Chinese fonts.

value.name: "cpsp"
value.desc: Capital Spacing. Should not be used in connecting scripts (e.g. most Arabic).

value.name: "cswh"
value.desc: Contextual Swash.

value.name: "curs"
value.desc: Cursive Positioning. Can be used in any cursive script.

value.name: "c2pc"
value.desc: Petite Capitals From Capitals. Applies only to bicameral scripts.

value.name: "c2cs"
value.desc: Small Capitals From Capitals. Applies only to bicameral scripts.

value.name: "dist"
value.desc: Distances. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "dlig"
value.desc: Discretionary ligatures.

value.name: "dnom"
value.desc: Denominators.

value.name: "dtls"
value.desc: Dotless Forms. Applied to math formula layout.

value.name: "expt"
value.desc: Expert Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "falt"
value.desc: Final Glyph on Line Alternates. Can be used in any cursive script.

value.name: "fin2"
value.desc: Terminal Form #2. Used only with the Syriac script.

value.name: "fin3"
value.desc: Terminal Form #3. Used only with the Syriac script.

value.name: "fina"
value.desc: Terminal Forms. Can be used in any alphabetic script.

value.name: "flac"
value.desc: Flattened ascent forms. Applied to math formula layout.

value.name: "frac"
value.desc: Fractions.

value.name: "fwid"
value.desc: Full Widths. Applies to any script which can use monospaced forms.

value.name: "half"
value.desc: Half Forms. Required in Indic scripts that show similarity to Devanagari.

value.name: "haln"
value.desc: Halant Forms. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "halt"
value.desc: Alternate Half Widths. Used only in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "hist"
value.desc: Historical Forms.

value.name: "hkna"
value.desc: Horizontal Kana Alternates. Applies only to fonts that support kana (hiragana and katakana).

value.name: "hlig"
value.desc: Historical Ligatures.

value.name: "hngl"
value.desc: Hangul. Korean only.

value.name: "hojo"
value.desc: Hojo Kanji Forms (JIS X 0212-1990 Kanji Forms). Used only with Kanji script.

value.name: "hwid"
value.desc: Half Widths. Generally used only in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "init"
value.desc: Initial Forms. Can be used in any alphabetic script.

value.name: "isol"
value.desc: Isolated Forms. Can be used in any cursive script.

value.name: "ital"
value.desc: Italics. Applies mostly to Latin; note that many non-Latin fonts contain Latin as well.

value.name: "jalt"
value.desc: Justification Alternates. Can be used in any cursive script.

value.name: "jp78"
value.desc: JIS78 Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "jp83"
value.desc: JIS83 Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "jp90"
value.desc: JIS90 Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "jp04"
value.desc: JIS2004 Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "kern"
value.desc: Kerning.

value.name: "lfbd"
value.desc: Left Bounds.

value.name: "liga"
value.desc: Standard Ligatures.

value.name: "ljmo"
value.desc: Leading Jamo Forms. Required for Hangul script when Ancient Hangul writing system is supported.

value.name: "lnum"
value.desc: Lining Figures.

value.name: "locl"
value.desc: Localized Forms.

value.name: "ltra"
value.desc: Left-to-right glyph alternates.

value.name: "ltrm"
value.desc: Left-to-right mirrored forms.

value.name: "mark"
value.desc: Mark Positioning.

value.name: "med2"
value.desc: Medial Form #2. Used only with the Syriac script.

value.name: "medi"
value.desc: Medial Forms.

value.name: "mgrk"
value.desc: Mathematical Greek.

value.name: "mkmk"
value.desc: Mark to Mark Positioning.

value.name: "nalt"
value.desc: Alternate Annotation Forms.

value.name: "nlck"
value.desc: NLC Kanji Forms. Used only with Kanji script.

value.name: "nukt"
value.desc: Nukta Forms. Required in Indic scripts..

value.name: "numr"
value.desc: Numerators.

value.name: "onum"
value.desc: Oldstyle Figures.

value.name: "opbd"
value.desc: Optical Bounds.

value.name: "ordn"
value.desc: Ordinals. Applies mostly to Latin script.

value.name: "ornm"
value.desc: Ornaments.

value.name: "palt"
value.desc: Proportional Alternate Widths. Used mostly in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "pcap"
value.desc: Petite Capitals.

value.name: "pkna"
value.desc: Proportional Kana. Generally used only in Japanese fonts.

value.name: "pnum"
value.desc: Proportional Figures.

value.name: "pref"
value.desc: Pre-base Forms. Required in Khmer and Myanmar (Burmese) scripts and southern Indic scripts that may display a pre-base form of Ra.

value.name: "pres"
value.desc: Pre-base Substitutions. Required in Indic scripts.

value.name: "pstf"
value.desc: Post-base Forms. Required in scripts of south and southeast Asia that have post-base forms for consonants eg: Gurmukhi, Malayalam, Khmer.

value.name: "psts"
value.desc: Post-base Substitutions.

value.name: "pwid"
value.desc: Proportional Widths.

value.name: "qwid"
value.desc: Quarter Widths. Generally used only in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "rand"
value.desc: Randomize.

value.name: "rclt"
value.desc: Required Contextual Alternates. May apply to any script, but is especially important for many styles of Arabic.

value.name: "rlig"
value.desc: Required Ligatures. Applies to Arabic and Syriac. May apply to some other scripts.

value.name: "rkrf"
value.desc: Rakar Forms. Required in Devanagari and Gujarati scripts.

value.name: "rphf"
value.desc: Reph Form. Required in Indic scripts. E.g. Devanagari, Kannada.

value.name: "rtbd"
value.desc: Right Bounds.

value.name: "rtla"
value.desc: Right-to-left alternates.

value.name: "rtlm"
value.desc: Right-to-left mirrored forms.

value.name: "ruby"
value.desc: Ruby Notation Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "salt"
value.desc: Stylistic Alternates.

value.name: "sinf"
value.desc: Scientific Inferiors.

value.name: "size"
value.desc: Optical size.

value.name: "smcp"
value.desc: Small Capitals. Applies only to bicameral scripts.

value.name: "smpl"
value.desc: Simplified Forms. Applies only to Chinese and Japanese.

value.name: "ssty"
value.desc: Math script style alternates.

value.name: "stch"
value.desc: Stretching Glyph Decomposition.

value.name: "subs"
value.desc: Subscript.

value.name: "sups"
value.desc: Superscript.

value.name: "swsh"
value.desc: Swash. Does not apply to ideographic scripts.

value.name: "titl"
value.desc: Titling.

value.name: "tjmo"
value.desc: Trailing Jamo Forms. Required for Hangul script when Ancient Hangul writing system is supported.

value.name: "tnam"
value.desc: Traditional Name Forms. Applies only to Japanese.

value.name: "tnum"
value.desc: Tabular Figures.

value.name: "trad"
value.desc: Traditional Forms. Applies only to Chinese and Japanese.

value.name: "twid"
value.desc: Third Widths. Generally used only in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "unic"
value.desc: Unicase.

value.name: "valt"
value.desc: Alternate Vertical Metrics. Applies only to scripts with vertical writing modes.

value.name: "vatu"
value.desc: Vattu Variants. Used for Indic scripts. E.g. Devanagari.

value.name: "vert"
value.desc: Vertical Alternates. Applies only to scripts with vertical writing modes.

value.name: "vhal"
value.desc: Alternate Vertical Half Metrics. Used only in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "vjmo"
value.desc: Vowel Jamo Forms. Required for Hangul script when Ancient Hangul writing system is supported.

value.name: "vkna"
value.desc: Vertical Kana Alternates. Applies only to fonts that support kana (hiragana and katakana).

value.name: "vkrn"
value.desc: Vertical Kerning.

value.name: "vpal"
value.desc: Proportional Alternate Vertical Metrics. Used mostly in CJKV fonts.

value.name: "vrt2"
value.desc: Vertical Alternates and Rotation. Applies only to scripts with vertical writing modes.

value.name: "zero"
value.desc: Slashed Zero.

value.name: normal
value.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

value.name: off
value.desc: Disable feature.

value.name: on
value.desc: Enable feature.

entry.name: font-kerning
entry.desc: Kerning is the contextual adjustment of inter-glyph spacing. This property controls metric kerning, kerning that utilizes adjustment data contained in the font.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Specifies that kerning is applied at the discretion of the user agent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Specifies that kerning is not applied.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Specifies that kerning is applied.

entry.name: font-language-override
entry.desc: The value of 'normal' implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Implies that when rendering with OpenType fonts the language of the document is used to infer the OpenType language system, used to select language specific features when rendering.

entry.name: font-size
entry.desc: Indicates the desired height of glyphs from the font. For scalable fonts, the font-size is a scale factor applied to the EM unit of the font. (Note that certain glyphs may bleed outside their EM box.) For non-scalable fonts, the font-size is converted into absolute units and matched against the declared font-size of the font, using the same absolute coordinate space for both of the matched values.

entry.name: font-size-adjust
entry.desc: Preserves the readability of text when font fallback occurs by adjusting the font-size so that the x-height is the same irregardless of the font used.

value.name: none
value.desc: Do not preserve the font’s x-height.

entry.name: font-stretch
entry.desc: Selects a normal, condensed, or expanded face from a font family.

value.name: narrower
value.desc: Indicates a narrower value relative to the width of the parent element.

value.name: wider
value.desc: Indicates a wider value relative to the width of the parent element.

entry.name: font-style
entry.desc: Allows italic or oblique faces to be selected. Italic forms are generally cursive in nature while oblique faces are typically sloped versions of the regular face.

value.name: italic
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'italic' face, or an 'oblique' face if one is not

value.name: normal
value.desc: Selects a face that is classified as 'normal'.

value.name: oblique
value.desc: Selects a font that is labeled as an 'oblique' face, or an 'italic' face if one is not.

entry.name: font-synthesis
entry.desc: Controls whether user agents are allowed to synthesize bold or oblique font faces when a font family lacks bold or italic faces.

value.name: none
value.desc: Disallow all synthetic faces.

value.name: style
value.desc: Allow synthetic italic faces.

value.name: weight
value.desc: Allow synthetic bold faces.

entry.name: font-variant
entry.desc: Specifies variant representations of the font

value.name: normal
value.desc: Specifies a face that is not labeled as a small-caps font.

value.name: small-caps
value.desc: Specifies a font that is labeled as a small-caps font. If a genuine small-caps font is not available, user agents should simulate a small-caps font.

entry.name: font-variant-alternates
entry.desc: For any given character, fonts can provide a variety of alternate glyphs in addition to the default glyph for that character. This property provides control over the selection of these alternate glyphs.

value.name: annotation()
value.desc: Enables display of alternate annotation forms.

value.name: character-variant()
value.desc: Enables display of specific character variants.

value.name: historical-forms
value.desc: Enables display of historical forms.

value.name: normal
value.desc: None of the features are enabled.

value.name: ornaments()
value.desc: Enables replacement of default glyphs with ornaments, if provided in the font.

value.name: styleset()
value.desc: Enables display with stylistic sets.

value.name: stylistic()
value.desc: Enables display of stylistic alternates.

value.name: swash()
value.desc: Enables display of swash glyphs.

entry.name: font-variant-caps
entry.desc: Specifies control over capitalized forms.

value.name: all-petite-caps
value.desc: Enables display of petite capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.

value.name: all-small-caps
value.desc: Enables display of small capitals for both upper and lowercase letters.

value.name: normal
value.desc: None of the features are enabled.

value.name: petite-caps
value.desc: Enables display of petite capitals.

value.name: small-caps
value.desc: Enables display of small capitals. Small-caps glyphs typically use the form of uppercase letters but are reduced to the size of lowercase letters.

value.name: titling-caps
value.desc: Enables display of titling capitals.

value.name: unicase
value.desc: Enables display of mixture of small capitals for uppercase letters with normal lowercase letters.

entry.name: font-variant-east-asian
entry.desc: Allows control of glyph substitute and positioning in East Asian text.

value.name: full-width
value.desc: Enables rendering of full-width variants.

value.name: jis04
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS04 forms.

value.name: jis78
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS78 forms.

value.name: jis83
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS83 forms.

value.name: jis90
value.desc: Enables rendering of JIS90 forms.

value.name: normal
value.desc: None of the features are enabled.

value.name: proportional-width
value.desc: Enables rendering of proportionally-spaced variants.

value.name: ruby
value.desc: Enables display of ruby variant glyphs.

value.name: simplified
value.desc: Enables rendering of simplified forms.

value.name: traditional
value.desc: Enables rendering of traditional forms.

entry.name: font-variant-ligatures
entry.desc: Specifies control over which ligatures are enabled or disabled. A value of ‘normal’ implies that the defaults set by the font are used.

value.name: additional-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of additional ligatures.

value.name: common-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of common ligatures.

value.name: contextual
value.desc: Enables display of contextual alternates.

value.name: discretionary-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of discretionary ligatures.

value.name: historical-ligatures
value.desc: Enables display of historical ligatures.

value.name: no-additional-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of additional ligatures.

value.name: no-common-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of common ligatures.

value.name: no-contextual
value.desc: Disables display of contextual alternates.

value.name: no-discretionary-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of discretionary ligatures.

value.name: no-historical-ligatures
value.desc: Disables display of historical ligatures.

value.name: none
value.desc: Disables all ligatures.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Implies that the defaults set by the font are used.

entry.name: font-variant-numeric
entry.desc: Specifies control over numerical forms.

value.name: diagonal-fractions
value.desc: Enables display of lining diagonal fractions.

value.name: lining-nums
value.desc: Enables display of lining numerals.

value.name: normal
value.desc: None of the features are enabled.

value.name: oldstyle-nums
value.desc: Enables display of old-style numerals.

value.name: ordinal
value.desc: Enables display of letter forms used with ordinal numbers.

value.name: proportional-nums
value.desc: Enables display of proportional numerals.

value.name: slashed-zero
value.desc: Enables display of slashed zeros.

value.name: stacked-fractions
value.desc: Enables display of lining stacked fractions.

value.name: tabular-nums
value.desc: Enables display of tabular numerals.

entry.name: font-variant-position
entry.desc: Specifies the vertical position

value.name: normal
value.desc: None of the features are enabled.

value.name: sub
value.desc: Enables display of subscript variants (OpenType feature: subs).

value.name: super
value.desc: Enables display of superscript variants (OpenType feature: sups).

entry.name: font-weight
entry.desc: Specifies weight of glyphs in the font, their degree of blackness or stroke thickness.

value.desc: Thin
Extra Light (Ultra Light)
Light
Normal
Medium
Semi Bold (Demi Bold)
Bold
Extra Bold (Ultra Bold)
Black (Heavy)

value.name: bold
value.desc: Same as 700

value.name: bolder
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face bolder than the inherited value.

value.name: lighter
value.desc: Specifies the weight of the face lighter than the inherited value.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Same as 400

entry.name: glyph-orientation-horizontal
entry.desc: Controls glyph orientation when the inline-progression-direction is horizontal.

entry.name: glyph-orientation-vertical
entry.desc: Controls glyph orientation when the inline-progression-direction is vertical.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Sets the orientation based on the fullwidth or non-fullwidth characters and the most common orientation.

entry.name: grid-area
entry.desc: Determine a grid item’s size and location within the grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement. Shorthand for 'grid-row-start', 'grid-column-start', 'grid-row-end', and 'grid-column-end'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-auto-columns
entry.desc: Specifies the size of implicitly created columns.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: auto
value.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: minmax()
value.desc: Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max.

entry.name: grid-auto-flow
entry.desc: Controls how the auto-placement algorithm works, specifying exactly how auto-placed items get flowed into the grid.

value.name: row
value.desc: The auto-placement algorithm places items by filling each row in turn, adding new rows as necessary.

value.name: column
value.desc: The auto-placement algorithm places items by filling each column in turn, adding new columns as necessary.

value.name: dense
value.desc: If specified, the auto-placement algorithm uses a “dense” packing algorithm, which attempts to fill in holes earlier in the grid if smaller items come up later.

entry.name: grid-auto-rows
entry.desc: Specifies the size of implicitly created rows.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: auto
value.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: minmax()
value.desc: Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max.

entry.name: grid-column
entry.desc: Shorthand for 'grid-column-start' and 'grid-column-end'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-column-end
entry.desc: Determine a grid item’s size and location within the grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-column-gap
entry.desc: Specifies the gutters between grid columns.

entry.name: grid-column-start
entry.desc: Determine a grid item’s size and location within the grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-gap
entry.desc: Shorthand that specifies the gutters between grid columns and grid rows in one declaration.

entry.name: grid-row
entry.desc: Shorthand for 'grid-row-start' and 'grid-row-end'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-row-end
entry.desc: Determine a grid item’s size and location within the grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-row-gap
entry.desc: Specifies the gutters between grid rows.

entry.name: grid-row-start
entry.desc: Determine a grid item’s size and location within the grid by contributing a line, a span, or nothing (automatic) to its grid placement.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The property contributes nothing to the grid item’s placement, indicating auto-placement, an automatic span, or a default span of one.

value.name: span
value.desc: Contributes a grid span to the grid item’s placement such that the corresponding edge of the grid item’s grid area is N lines from its opposite edge.

entry.name: grid-template
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting grid-template-columns, grid-template-rows, and grid-template-areas in a single declaration.

value.name: none
value.desc: Sets all three properties to their initial values.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: auto
value.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: subgrid
value.desc: Sets 'grid-template-rows' and 'grid-template-columns' to 'subgrid', and 'grid-template-areas' to its initial value.

value.name: minmax()
value.desc: Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max.

value.name: repeat()
value.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

entry.name: grid-template-areas
entry.desc: Specifies named grid areas, which are not associated with any particular grid item, but can be referenced from the grid-placement properties.

value.name: none
value.desc: The grid container doesn’t define any named grid areas.

entry.name: grid-template-columns
entry.desc: specifies, as a space-separated track list, the line names and track sizing functions of the grid.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no explicit grid; any rows/columns will be implicitly generated.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: auto
value.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: subgrid
value.desc: Indicates that the grid will align to its parent grid in that axis.

value.name: minmax()
value.desc: Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max.

value.name: repeat()
value.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

entry.name: grid-template-rows
entry.desc: specifies, as a space-separated track list, the line names and track sizing functions of the grid.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no explicit grid; any rows/columns will be implicitly generated.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Represents the largest min-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Represents the largest max-content contribution of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: auto
value.desc: As a maximum, identical to 'max-content'. As a minimum, represents the largest minimum size (as specified by min-width/min-height) of the grid items occupying the grid track.

value.name: subgrid
value.desc: Indicates that the grid will align to its parent grid in that axis.

value.name: minmax()
value.desc: Defines a size range greater than or equal to min and less than or equal to max.

value.name: repeat()
value.desc: Represents a repeated fragment of the track list, allowing a large number of columns or rows that exhibit a recurring pattern to be written in a more compact form.

entry.name: hanging-punctuation
entry.desc: Determines whether a punctuation mark, if one is present, may be placed outside the content area at the start or at the end of a full line of text.

value.name: allow-end
value.desc: A stop or comma at the end of a line hangs if it does not otherwise fit prior to justification.

value.name: first
value.desc: An opening bracket or quote at the start of the first formatted line of an element hangs.

value.name: force-end
value.desc: A stop or comma at the end of a line hangs.

value.name: last
value.desc: A closing bracket or quote at the end of the last formatted line of an element hangs.

value.name: none
value.desc: No characters can hang.

entry.name: height
entry.desc: Specifies the height of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The height depends on the values of other properties.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Use the fill-available inline size or fill-available block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

entry.name: hyphenate-character
entry.desc: Specifies strings that are shown between parts of hyphenated words.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent should find an appropriate value, preferably from the same source as the hyphenation dictionary.

entry.name: hyphenate-limit-chars
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent chooses a value that adapts to the current layout.

entry.name: hyphenate-limit-last
entry.desc: Indicates hyphenation behavior at the end of elements, column, pages and spreads.

value.name: none
value.desc: No restrictions imposed.

value.name: always
value.desc: The last full line of the element, or the last line before any column, page, or spread break inside the element should not be hyphenated.

value.name: column
value.desc: The last line before any column, page, or spread break inside the element should not be hyphenated.

value.name: page
value.desc: The last line before page or spread break inside the element should not be hyphenated.

value.name: spread
value.desc: The last line before any spread break inside the element should not be hyphenated.

entry.name: hyphenate-limit-lines
entry.desc: Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines in an element.

value.name: no-limit
value.desc: There is no limit.

entry.name: hyphenate-limit-zone
entry.desc: Specifies the maximum amount of unfilled space (before justification) that may be left in the line box before hyphenation is triggered to pull part of a word from the next line back up into the current line.

entry.name: hyphens
entry.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

value.name: manual
value.desc: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

value.name: none
value.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

entry.name: image-orientation
entry.desc: Specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

value.name: flip
value.desc: After rotating by the precededing angle, the image is flipped horizontally. Defaults to 0deg if the angle is ommitted.

value.name: from-image
value.desc: If the image has an orientation specified in its metadata, such as EXIF, this value computes to the angle that the metadata specifies is necessary to correctly orient the image.

entry.name: image-rendering
entry.desc: Provides a hint to the user-agent about what aspects of an image are most important to preserve when the image is scaled, to aid the user-agent in the choice of an appropriate scaling algorithm.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The image should be scaled with an algorithm that maximizes the appearance of the image.

value.name: crisp-edges
value.desc: The image must be scaled with an algorithm that preserves contrast and edges in the image, and which does not smooth colors or introduce blur to the image in the process.

value.name: optimizeQuality
value.desc: Deprecated.

value.name: optimizeSpeed
value.desc: Deprecated.

value.name: pixelated
value.desc: When scaling the image up, the 'nearest neighbor' or similar algorithm must be used, so that the image appears to be simply composed of very large pixels.

entry.name: image-resolution
entry.desc: Specifies the intrinsic resolution of all raster images used in or on the element.

value.name: from-image
value.desc: The image's intrinsic resolution is taken as that specified by the image format. If the image does not specify its own resolution, the explicitly specified resolution is used (if given), else it defaults to '1dppx'.

value.name: snap
value.desc: If the 'snap' keyword is provided, the computed resolution (if any) is the specified resolution rounded to the nearest value that would map one image pixel to an integer number of device pixels.

entry.name: ime-mode
entry.desc: Controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.

value.name: active
value.desc: The input method editor is initially active; text entry is performed using it unless the user specifically dismisses it.

value.name: auto
value.desc: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.

value.name: disabled
value.desc: The input method editor is disabled and may not be activated by the user.

value.name: inactive
value.desc: The input method editor is initially inactive, but the user may activate it if they wish.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting.

entry.name: initial-letter
entry.desc: Specifies styling for dropped, raised, and sunken initial letters.

value.name: normal
value.desc: No special initial-letter effect. Text behaves as normal.

entry.name: initial-letter-align
entry.desc: Specifies the alignment points used to size and position an initial letter.

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: Use the alphabetic and cap-height baselines of the surrounding text to align the initial letter.

value.name: ideographic
value.desc: Use the ideographic character face bottom and top edge baselines of the surrounding text to align the initial letter.

value.name: hebrew
value.desc: Use the alphabetic and (as yet theoretical) hebrew hanging baseline of the surrounding text to align the initial letter.

value.name: hanging
value.desc: Use the alphabetic and hanging baselines of the surrounding text to align the initial letter.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: Uses the initial letter box’s line-over and line-under border edges as the over and under alignment points, respectively.

entry.name: initial-letter-wrap
entry.desc: Specifies whether lines impacted by an initial letter are shortened to fit the rectangular shape of the initial letter box or follow the contour of its end-edge glyph outline.

value.name: none
value.desc: No contour-fitting is performed: each impacted line is aligned flush to the end margin edge of the initial letter.

value.name: first
value.desc: Behaves as none if the first typographic character unit after the initial letter belongs to Unicode General Category Zs. Otherwise behaves as for all on the first line of the block containing the initial letter and as none on the rest.

value.name: all
value.desc: For each line of text impacted by the initial letter, the line box adjacent to the intial letter starts at the start-most point that touches the ink of the initial letter, plus the amount of the initial letter’s end-side border+padding+margin.

value.name: grid
value.desc: This value is the same as none, except that the exclusion area of the impacted lines is increased as necessary for its end-edge to land on the character grid.

entry.name: inline-size
entry.desc: Logical 'height'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: isolation
entry.desc: In CSS setting to 'isolate' will turn the element into a stacking context. In SVG, it defines whether an element is isolated or not.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Elements are not isolated unless an operation is applied that causes the creation of a stacking context.

value.name: isolate
value.desc: In CSS will turn the element into a stacking context.

entry.name: justify-content
entry.desc: Aligns flex items along the main axis of the current line of the flex container.

value.name: center
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

value.name: flex-end
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

value.name: flex-start
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

value.name: space-around
value.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end.

value.name: space-between
value.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

entry.name: kerning
entry.desc: Indicates whether the user agent should adjust inter-glyph spacing based on kerning tables that are included in the relevant font or instead disable auto-kerning and set inter-character spacing to a specific length.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should adjust inter-glyph spacing based on kerning tables that are included in the font that will be used.

entry.name: left
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's left margin edge is offset to the right of the left edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: letter-spacing
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum, maximum, and optimal spacing between grapheme clusters.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The spacing is the normal spacing for the current font. It is typically zero-length.

entry.name: lighting-color
entry.desc: Defines the color of the light source for filter primitives 'feDiffuseLighting' and 'feSpecularLighting'.

entry.name: line-break
entry.desc: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.

value.name: loose
value.desc: Breaks text using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Breaks text using the most common set of line-breaking rules.

value.name: strict
value.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.

entry.name: line-grid
entry.desc: Specifies whether this box creates a new baseline grid for its descendants or uses the same baseline grid as its parent.

value.name: match-parent
value.desc: Box assumes the line grid of its parent if its writing mode is the same as its parent.

value.name: create
value.desc: Box creates a new line grid using its own font and line layout settings.

entry.name: line-height
entry.desc: Determines the block-progression dimension of the text content area of an inline box.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Tells user agents to set the computed value to a 'reasonable' value based on the font size of the element.

entry.name: line-snap
entry.desc: Snaps line boxes contained by the element to the line grid specified by the 'line-grid' property.

value.name: none
value.desc: Line boxes do not snap to the grid; they stack normally.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: The dominant baseline snaps with the matching baseline on the line grid applying to the element.

value.name: contain
value.desc: Two baselines are used to align the line box.

entry.name: list-style
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'list-style-type', 'list-style-position' and 'list-style-image'

value.name: circle
value.desc: A hollow circle.

value.name: disc
value.desc: A filled circle.

value.name: hanging
value.desc: As 'inside', except the marker is instead placed immediately before the first text or significant whitespace in the list item or its children

value.name: inside
value.desc: The marker box is outside the principal block box, as described in the section on the ::marker pseudo-element below.

value.name: outside
value.desc: The ::marker pseudo-element is an inline element placed immediately before all ::before pseudo-elements in the principal block box, after which the element's content flows.

value.name: square
value.desc: A filled square.

value.name: symbols()
value.desc: Allows a counter style to be defined inline.

entry.name: list-style-image
entry.desc: Sets the image that will be used as the list item marker. When the image is available, it will replace the marker set with the 'list-style-type' marker.

value.name: none
value.desc: The default contents of the of the list item’s marker are given by 'list-style-type' instead.

entry.name: list-style-position
entry.desc: Specifies the position of the '::marker' pseudo-element's box in the list item.

value.name: inside
value.desc: The marker box is outside the principal block box, as described in the section on the ::marker pseudo-element below.

value.name: outside
value.desc: The ::marker pseudo-element is an inline element placed immediately before all ::before pseudo-elements in the principal block box, after which the element's content flows.

entry.name: list-style-type
entry.desc: Used to construct the default contents of a list item’s marker

entry.name: margin
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: margin-block-end
entry.desc: Logical 'margin-bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: margin-block-start
entry.desc: Logical 'margin-top'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: margin-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-inline-end
entry.desc: Logical 'margin-right'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: margin-inline-start
entry.desc: Logical 'margin-left'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: margin-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: margin-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the margin area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: marker
entry.desc: Specifies the marker symbol that shall be used for all points on the sets the value for all vertices on the given ‘path’ element or basic shape.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that no marker symbol will be drawn at the given vertex or vertices.

value.name: child
value.desc: Indicates that the last child <marker> element of the element where the property is specified will be used.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Indicates that the <marker> element referenced will be used.

entry.name: marker-end
entry.desc: Specifies the marker that will be drawn at the last vertices of the given markable element.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that no marker symbol will be drawn at the given vertex or vertices.

value.name: child
value.desc: Indicates that the last child <marker> element of the element where the property is specified will be used.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Indicates that the <marker> element referenced will be used.

entry.name: marker-mid
entry.desc: Specifies the marker that will be drawn at all vertices except the first and last.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that no marker symbol will be drawn at the given vertex or vertices.

value.name: child
value.desc: Indicates that the last child <marker> element of the element where the property is specified will be used.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Indicates that the <marker> element referenced will be used.

entry.name: marker-side
entry.desc: Specifies if list item markers position themselves relative to the list item or the list container’s directionality.

value.name: list-item
value.desc: Any markers associated with the list item base their positioning off of the directionality of the list item.

value.name: list-container
value.desc: The associated markers instead base their positioning off of the directionality of the list item’s parent element.

entry.name: marker-start
entry.desc: Specifies the marker that will be drawn at the first vertices of the given markable element.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that no marker symbol will be drawn at the given vertex or vertices.

value.name: child
value.desc: Indicates that the last child <marker> element of the element where the property is specified will be used.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Indicates that the <marker> element referenced will be used.

entry.name: mask
entry.restriction: url, image, length, percentage, position, repeat, geometry-box, enum
entry.desc: The mask shorthand.

value.name: none
value.desc: Counts as a transparent black image layer.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Reference to a <mask element or to a CSS image.

value.name: alpha
value.desc: Alpha values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values.

value.name: luminance
value.desc: Luminance values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values.

value.name: contain
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

value.name: cover
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

value.name: no-clip
value.desc: The painted content is not restricted (not clipped).

value.name: add
value.desc: The source is placed over the destination.

value.name: exclude
value.desc: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined.

value.name: intersect
value.desc: The parts of source that overlap the destination, replace the destination.

value.name: subtract
value.desc: The source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination.

entry.name: mask-border
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'mask-border-source', 'mask-border-slice', 'mask-border-width', 'mask-border-outset', 'mask-border-repeat', and 'mask-border-mode'.

value.name: none
value.desc: No mask border image.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The mask border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

value.name: alpha
value.desc: Alpha values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values.

value.name: luminance
value.desc: Luminance values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values.

entry.name: mask-border-mode
entry.desc: Indicates whether the image value for 'mask-border-source' is treated as luminance mask or alpha mask.

value.name: alpha
value.desc: Alpha values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values.

value.name: luminance
value.desc: Luminance values of the mask border image should be used as the mask values.

entry.name: mask-border-outset
entry.desc: Specifies the amount by which the mask border image area extends beyond the border box.

entry.name: mask-border-repeat
entry.desc: Specifies how the images for the sides and the middle part of the mask border image are scaled and tiled.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: mask-border-slice
entry.desc: Specifies inward offsets from the top, right, bottom, and left edges of the mask border image, dividing it into nine regions: four corners, four edges and a middle.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

entry.name: mask-border-source
entry.desc: Specifies an image to be used as mask border image.

value.name: none
value.desc: No mask border image.

entry.name: mask-border-width
entry.desc: Specifies offsets that are used to divide the mask border image area into nine parts.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The mask border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

entry.name: mask-clip
entry.desc: Determines the mask painting area, which determines the area that is affected by the mask.

value.name: no-clip
value.desc: The painted content is not restricted (not clipped).

entry.name: mask-composite
entry.desc: Defines the compositing operation used on the current mask layer with the mask layers below it.

value.name: add
value.desc: The source is placed over the destination.

value.name: exclude
value.desc: The non-overlapping regions of source and destination are combined.

value.name: intersect
value.desc: The parts of source that overlap the destination, replace the destination.

value.name: subtract
value.desc: The source is placed, where it falls outside of the destination.

entry.name: mask-image
entry.desc: Sets the mask layer image of an element.

value.name: none
value.desc: Counts as a transparent black image layer.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Reference to a <mask element or to a CSS image.

entry.name: mask-mode
entry.desc: Indicates whether the mask layer image is treated as luminance mask or alpha mask.

value.name: alpha
value.desc: Alpha values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Use alpha values if 'mask-image' is an image, luminance if a <mask> element or a CSS image.

value.name: luminance
value.desc: Luminance values of the mask layer image should be used as the mask values.

entry.name: mask-origin
entry.desc: Specifies the mask positioning area.

entry.name: mask-position
entry.desc: Specifies how mask layer images are positioned.

entry.name: mask-repeat
entry.desc: Specifies how mask layer images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

entry.name: mask-size
entry.desc: Specifies the size of the mask layer images.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Resolved by using the image’s intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image’s intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

value.name: contain
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

value.name: cover
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

entry.name: mask-type
entry.desc: Defines whether the content of the <mask> element is treated as as luminance mask or alpha mask.

value.name: alpha
value.desc: Indicates that the alpha values of the mask should be used.

value.name: luminance
value.desc: Indicates that the luminance values of the mask should be used.

entry.name: max-block-size
entry.desc: Logical 'max-width'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the width of the box.

entry.name: max-height
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the height of the box.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Use the fill-available inline size or fill-available block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

entry.name: max-inline-size
entry.desc: Logical 'max-height'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the height of the box.

entry.name: max-width
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

value.name: none
value.desc: No limit on the width of the box.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Use the fill-available inline size or fill-available block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

entry.name: max-lines
entry.desc: Forces a fragment to break after the specified number of lines.

value.name: none
value.desc: Breaks occur only as specified elsewhere.

entry.name: max-zoom
entry.desc: @viewport descriptor. Specifies the largest allowed zoom factor.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The upper limit on zoom factor is UA dependant.

entry.name: min-block-size
entry.desc: Logical 'min-width'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

entry.name: min-height
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content height to a certain range.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Use the fill-available inline size or fill-available block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

entry.name: min-inline-size
entry.desc: Logical 'min-height'. Mapping depends on the element’s 'writing-mode'.

entry.name: min-width
entry.desc: Allows authors to constrain content width to a certain range.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Use the fill-available inline size or fill-available block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

entry.name: mix-blend-mode
entry.desc: Defines the formula that must be used to mix the colors with the backdrop.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Default attribute which specifies no blending

value.name: multiply
value.desc: The source color is multiplied by the destination color and replaces the destination.

value.name: screen
value.desc: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source color values, then complements the result.

value.name: overlay
value.desc: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the backdrop color value.

value.name: darken
value.desc: Selects the darker of the backdrop and source colors.

value.name: lighten
value.desc: Selects the lighter of the backdrop and source colors.

value.name: color-dodge
value.desc: Brightens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

value.name: color-burn
value.desc: Darkens the backdrop color to reflect the source color.

value.name: hard-light
value.desc: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source color value.

value.name: soft-light
value.desc: Darkens or lightens the colors, depending on the source color value.

value.name: difference
value.desc: Subtracts the darker of the two constituent colors from the lighter color..

value.name: exclusion
value.desc: Produces an effect similar to that of the Difference mode but lower in contrast.

value.name: hue
value.desc: Creates a color with the hue of the source color and the saturation and luminosity of the backdrop color.

value.name: saturation
value.desc: Creates a color with the saturation of the source color and the hue and luminosity of the backdrop color.

value.name: color
value.desc: Creates a color with the hue and saturation of the source color and the luminosity of the backdrop color.

value.name: luminosity
value.desc: Creates a color with the luminosity of the source color and the hue and saturation of the backdrop color.

entry.name: min-zoom
entry.desc: @viewport descriptor. Specifies the smallest allowed zoom factor.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The lower limit on zoom factor is UA dependant.

entry.name: motion
entry.restriction: url, length, percentage, angle, shape, geometry-box, enum
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'motion-path', 'motion-offset' and 'motion-rotation'.

value.name: none
value.desc: No motion path gets created.

value.name: path()
value.desc: Defines an SVG path as a string, with optional 'fill-rule' as the first argument.

value.name: url()
value.desc: References an SVG shape element and uses its geometry as motion path.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Indicates that the object is rotated by the angle of the direction of the motion path.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: Indicates that the object is rotated by the angle of the direction of the motion path plus 180 degrees.

entry.name: motion-offset
entry.desc: A distance that describes the position along the specified motion path.

entry.name: motion-path
entry.desc: Specifies the motion path the element gets positioned at.

value.name: none
value.desc: No motion path gets created.

value.name: path()
value.desc: Defines an SVG path as a string, with optional 'fill-rule' as the first argument.

value.name: url()
value.desc: References an SVG shape element and uses its geometry as motion path.

entry.name: motion-rotation
entry.desc: Defines the direction of the element while positioning along the motion path.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Indicates that the object is rotated by the angle of the direction of the motion path.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: Indicates that the object is rotated by the angle of the direction of the motion path plus 180 degrees.

entry.name: move-to
entry.desc: Property causes the element or pseudo-element to be removed from the flow and reinserted at a later point in the document.

value.name: here
value.desc: The element or pseudo-element is not moved. This value inhibits the creation of '::alternate' pseudo-elements and any pseudo-elements that have such a pseudo-element as a superior.

value.name: normal
value.desc: For '::alternate' pseudo-elements, if the superior parent uses the 'footnote' counter in its 'content' property then the computed value of 'move-to' is 'footnotes'.

entry.name: -moz-animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -moz-animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

entry.name: -moz-animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -moz-animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: -moz-animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: -moz-animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: -moz-animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: -moz-animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

entry.name: -moz-appearance
entry.desc: Used in Gecko (Firefox) to display an element using a platform-native styling based on the operating system's theme.

entry.name: -moz-backface-visibility
entry.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

entry.name: -moz-background-clip
entry.desc: Determines the background painting area.

entry.name: -moz-background-inline-policy
entry.desc: In Gecko-based applications like Firefox, the -moz-background-inline-policy CSS property specifies how the background image of an inline element is determined when the content of the inline element wraps onto multiple lines. The choice of position has significant effects on repetition.

entry.name: -moz-background-origin
entry.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

entry.name: -moz-border-bottom-colors
entry.desc: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

entry.name: -moz-border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

value.name: repeat
