value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: -moz-border-left-colors
entry.desc: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

entry.name: -moz-border-right-colors
entry.desc: Sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

entry.name: -moz-border-top-colors
entry.desc: Ske Firefox, -moz-border-bottom-colors sets a list of colors for the bottom border.

entry.name: -moz-box-align
entry.desc: Specifies how a XUL box aligns its contents across (perpendicular to) the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

value.name: center
value.desc: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

value.name: end
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

value.name: start
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

entry.name: -moz-box-direction
entry.desc: Specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

value.name: normal
value.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

entry.name: -moz-box-flex
entry.desc: Specifies how a box grows to fill the box that contains it, in the direction of the containing box's layout.

entry.name: -moz-box-flexgroup
entry.desc: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

entry.name: -moz-box-ordinal-group
entry.desc: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

entry.name: -moz-box-orient
entry.desc: In Mozilla applications, -moz-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

value.name: block-axis
value.desc: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.

value.name: horizontal
value.desc: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

value.name: inline-axis
value.desc: Elements are oriented vertically.

value.name: vertical
value.desc: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

entry.name: -moz-box-pack
entry.desc: Specifies how a box packs its contents in the direction of its layout. The effect of this is only visible if there is extra space in the box.

value.name: center
value.desc: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

value.name: end
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

value.name: start
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

entry.name: -moz-box-sizing
entry.desc: Box Model addition in CSS3.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

value.name: padding-box
value.desc: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the padding box of the element.

entry.name: -moz-column-count
entry.desc: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

entry.name: -moz-column-gap
entry.desc: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

value.name: normal
value.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

entry.name: -moz-column-rule
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

entry.name: -moz-column-rule-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the column rule

entry.name: -moz-column-rule-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

entry.name: -moz-column-rule-width
entry.desc: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

entry.name: -moz-columns
entry.desc: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: -moz-column-width
entry.desc: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: -moz-font-feature-settings
entry.desc: Provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

value.name: normal
value.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

entry.name: -moz-hyphens
entry.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

value.name: manual
value.desc: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

value.name: none
value.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

entry.name: -moz-perspective
entry.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

value.name: none
value.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

entry.name: -moz-perspective-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: -moz-text-align-last
entry.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: -moz-text-decoration-color
entry.desc: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

entry.name: -moz-text-decoration-line
entry.desc: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

value.name: line-through
value.desc: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

value.name: none
value.desc: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

value.name: overline
value.desc: Each line of text has a line above it.

value.name: underline
value.desc: Each line of text is underlined.

entry.name: -moz-text-decoration-style
entry.desc: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: Produces a dashed line style.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: Produces a dotted line.

value.name: double
value.desc: Produces a double line.

value.name: none
value.desc: Produces no line.

value.name: solid
value.desc: Produces a solid line.

value.name: wavy
value.desc: Produces a wavy line.

entry.name: -moz-text-size-adjust
entry.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

value.name: none
value.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

entry.name: -moz-transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: perspective
value.desc: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: -moz-transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

entry.name: -moz-transition
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -moz-transition-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

entry.name: -moz-transition-duration
entry.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

entry.name: -moz-transition-property
entry.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -moz-transition-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

entry.name: -moz-user-focus
entry.desc: Used to indicate whether the element can have focus.

entry.name: -moz-user-select
entry.desc: Controls the appearance of selection.

entry.name: -ms-accelerator
entry.desc: IE only. Has the ability to turn off its system underlines for accelerator keys until the ALT key is pressed

value.name: false
value.desc: The element does not contain an accelerator key sequence.

value.name: true
value.desc: The element contains an accelerator key sequence.

entry.name: -ms-behavior
entry.desc: IE only. Used to extend behaviors of the browser

entry.name: -ms-block-progression
entry.desc: Sets the block-progression value and the flow orientation

value.name: bt
value.desc: Bottom-to-top block flow. Layout is horizontal.

value.name: lr
value.desc: Left-to-right direction. The flow orientation is vertical.

value.name: rl
value.desc: Right-to-left direction. The flow orientation is vertical.

value.name: tb
value.desc: Top-to-bottom direction. The flow orientation is horizontal.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-chaining
entry.desc: Specifies the zoom behavior that occurs when a user hits the zoom limit during a manipulation.

value.name: chained
value.desc: The nearest zoomable parent element begins zooming when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation. No bounce effect is shown.

value.name: none
value.desc: A bounce effect is shown when the user hits a zoom limit during a manipulation.

entry.name: -ms-content-zooming
entry.desc: Specifies whether zooming is enabled.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element is not zoomable.

value.name: zoom
value.desc: The element is zoomable.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit
entry.desc: Shorthand property for the -ms-content-zoom-limit-min and -ms-content-zoom-limit-max properties.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit-max
entry.desc: Specifies the maximum zoom factor.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-limit-min
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum zoom factor.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap
entry.desc: Shorthand property for the -ms-content-zoom-snap-type and -ms-content-zoom-snap-points properties.

value.name: mandatory
value.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points.

value.name: proximity
value.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point.

value.name: snapInterval(100%, 100%)
value.desc: Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

value.name: snapList()
value.desc: Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of zoom factors.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-points
entry.desc: Defines where zoom snap-points are located.

value.name: snapInterval(100%, 100%)
value.desc: Specifies where the snap-points will be placed.

value.name: snapList()
value.desc: Specifies the position of individual snap-points as a comma-separated list of zoom factors.

entry.name: -ms-content-zoom-snap-type
entry.desc: Specifies how zooming is affected by defined snap-points.

value.name: mandatory
value.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up is always adjusted so that it lands on a snap-point.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that zooming is unaffected by any defined snap-points.

value.name: proximity
value.desc: Indicates that the motion of the content after the contact is picked up may be adjusted if the content would normally stop "close enough" to a snap-point.

entry.name: -ms-filter
entry.desc: IE only. Used to produce visual effects.

entry.name: -ms-flex
entry.desc: specifies the parameters of a flexible length: the positive and negative flexibility, and the preferred size.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Retrieves the value of the main size property as the used 'flex-basis'.

value.name: none
value.desc: Expands to '0 0 auto'.

entry.name: -ms-flex-align
entry.desc: Aligns flex items along the cross axis of the current line of the flex container.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

value.name: center
value.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

value.name: end
value.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

value.name: start
value.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flexbox item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the cross size property of the flexbox item is anything other than 'auto', this value is identical to 'start'.

entry.name: -ms-flex-direction
entry.desc: Specifies how flex items are placed in the flex container, by setting the direction of the flex container’s main axis.

value.name: column
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: column-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

value.name: row
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: row-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'row', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: -ms-flex-flow
entry.desc: Specifies how flexbox items are placed in the flexbox.

value.name: column
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the block axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: column-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'column', except the main-start and main-end directions are swapped.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flex container is single-line.

value.name: row
value.desc: The flex container’s main axis has the same orientation as the inline axis of the current writing mode.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: -ms-flex-item-align
entry.desc: Allows the default alignment along the cross axis to be overridden for individual flex items.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Computes to the value of 'align-items' on the element’s parent, or 'stretch' if the element has no parent. On absolutely positioned elements, it computes to itself.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If the flex item’s inline axis is the same as the cross axis, this value is identical to 'flex-start'. Otherwise, it participates in baseline alignment.

value.name: center
value.desc: The flex item’s margin box is centered in the cross axis within the line.

value.name: end
value.desc: The cross-end margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-end edge of the line.

value.name: start
value.desc: The cross-start margin edge of the flex item is placed flush with the cross-start edge of the line.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: If the cross size property of the flex item computes to auto, and neither of the cross-axis margins are auto, the flex item is stretched.

entry.name: -ms-flex-line-pack
entry.desc: Aligns a flex container’s lines within the flex container when there is extra space in the cross-axis, similar to how 'justify-content' aligns individual items within the main-axis.

value.name: center
value.desc: Lines are packed toward the center of the flex container.

value.name: distribute
value.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container, with half-size spaces on either end.

value.name: end
value.desc: Lines are packed toward the end of the flex container.

value.name: justify
value.desc: Lines are evenly distributed in the flex container.

value.name: start
value.desc: Lines are packed toward the start of the flex container.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: Lines stretch to take up the remaining space.

entry.name: -ms-flex-order
entry.desc: Controls the order in which children of a flex container appear within the flex container, by assigning them to ordinal groups.

entry.name: -ms-flex-pack
entry.desc: Aligns flex items along the main axis of the current line of the flex container.

value.name: center
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the center of the line.

value.name: distribute
value.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line, with half-size spaces on either end.

value.name: end
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the end of the line.

value.name: justify
value.desc: Flex items are evenly distributed in the line.

value.name: start
value.desc: Flex items are packed toward the start of the line.

entry.name: -ms-flex-wrap
entry.desc: Controls whether the flex container is single-line or multi-line, and the direction of the cross-axis, which determines the direction new lines are stacked in.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: The flex container is single-line.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The flexbox is multi-line.

value.name: wrap-reverse
value.desc: Same as 'wrap', except the cross-start and cross-end directions are swapped.

entry.name: -ms-flow-from
entry.desc: Makes a block container a region and associates it with a named flow.

value.name: none
value.desc: The block container is not a CSS Region.

entry.name: -ms-flow-into
entry.desc: Places an element or its contents into a named flow.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element is not moved to a named flow and normal CSS processing takes place.

entry.name: -ms-grid-column
entry.desc: Used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.

entry.name: -ms-grid-column-align
entry.desc: Aligns the columns in a grid.

value.name: center
value.desc: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's column.

value.name: end
value.desc: Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's column.

value.name: start
value.desc: Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's column.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's column.

entry.name: -ms-grid-columns
entry.desc: Lays out the columns of the grid.

entry.name: -ms-grid-column-span
entry.desc: Specifies the number of columns to span.

entry.name: -ms-grid-layer
entry.desc: Grid-layer is similar in concept to z-index, but avoids overloading the meaning of the z-index property, which is applicable only to positioned elements.

entry.name: -ms-grid-row
entry.desc: grid-row is used to place grid items and explicitly defined grid cells in the Grid.

entry.name: -ms-grid-row-align
entry.desc: Aligns the rows in a grid.

value.name: center
value.desc: Places the center of the Grid Item's margin box at the center of the Grid Item's row.

value.name: end
value.desc: Aligns the end edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the end edge of the Grid Item's row.

value.name: start
value.desc: Aligns the starting edge of the Grid Item's margin box to the starting edge of the Grid Item's row.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: Ensures that the Grid Item's margin box is equal to the size of the Grid Item's row.

entry.name: -ms-grid-rows
entry.desc: Lays out the columns of the grid.

entry.name: -ms-grid-row-span
entry.desc: Specifies the number of rows to span.

entry.name: -ms-high-contrast-adjust
entry.desc: Specifies if properties should be adjusted in high contrast mode.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Properties will be adjusted as applicable.

value.name: none
value.desc: No adjustments will be applied.

entry.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-chars
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum number of characters in a hyphenated word.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent chooses a value that adapts to the current layout.

entry.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-lines
entry.desc: Indicates the maximum number of successive hyphenated lines in an element.

value.name: no-limit
value.desc: There is no limit.

entry.name: -ms-hyphenate-limit-zone
entry.desc: Specifies the maximum amount of unfilled space (before justification) that may be left in the line box before hyphenation is triggered to pull part of a word from the next line back up into the current line.

entry.name: -ms-hyphens
entry.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

value.name: manual
value.desc: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

value.name: none
value.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

entry.name: -ms-ime-mode
entry.desc: Controls the state of the input method editor for text fields.

value.name: active
value.desc: The input method editor is initially active; text entry is performed using it unless the user specifically dismisses it.

value.name: auto
value.desc: No change is made to the current input method editor state. This is the default.

value.name: disabled
value.desc: The input method editor is disabled and may not be activated by the user.

value.name: inactive
value.desc: The input method editor is initially inactive, but the user may activate it if they wish.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The IME state should be normal; this value can be used in a user style sheet to override the page setting.

entry.name: -ms-interpolation-mode
entry.desc: Gets or sets the interpolation (resampling) method used to stretch images.

entry.name: -ms-layout-grid
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the composite document grid properties that specify the layout of text characters.

value.name: char
value.desc: Any of the range of character values available to the -ms-layout-grid-char property.

value.name: line
value.desc: Any of the range of line values available to the -ms-layout-grid-line property.

value.name: mode
value.desc: Any of the range of mode values available to the -ms-layout-grid-mode property.

value.name: type
value.desc: Any of the range of type values available to the -ms-layout-grid-type property.

entry.name: -ms-layout-grid-char
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the size of the character grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

value.name: none
value.desc: Default. No character grid is set.

entry.name: -ms-layout-grid-line
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the gridline value used for rendering the text content of an element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Largest character in the font of the element is used to set the character grid.

value.name: none
value.desc: Default. No grid line is set.

entry.name: -ms-layout-grid-mode
entry.desc: Gets or sets whether the text layout grid uses two dimensions.

value.name: both
value.desc: Default. Both the char and line grid modes are enabled. This setting is necessary to fully enable the layout grid on an element.

value.name: char
value.desc: Only a character grid is used. This is recommended for use with block-level elements, such as a blockquote, where the line grid is intended to be disabled.

value.name: line
value.desc: Only a line grid is used. This is recommended for use with inline elements, such as a span, to disable the horizontal grid on runs of text that act as a single entity in the grid layout.

value.name: none
value.desc: No grid is used.

entry.name: -ms-layout-grid-type
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the type of grid used for rendering the text content of an element.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: Grid used for monospaced layout. All noncursive characters are treated as equal; every character is centered within a single grid space by default.

value.name: loose
value.desc: Default. Grid used for Japanese and Korean characters.

value.name: strict
value.desc: Grid used for Chinese, as well as Japanese (Genko) and Korean characters. Only the ideographs, kanas, and wide characters are snapped to the grid.

entry.name: -ms-line-break
entry.desc: Specifies what set of line breaking restrictions are in effect within the element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the set of line-breaking restrictions to use for CJK scripts, and it may vary the restrictions based on the length of the line; e.g., use a less restrictive set of line-break rules for short lines.

value.name: keep-all
value.desc: Sequences of CJK characters can no longer break on implied break points. This option should only be used where the presence of word separator characters still creates line-breaking opportunities, as in Korean.

value.name: newspaper
value.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using the least restrictive set of line-breaking rules. Typically used for short lines, such as in newspapers.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using a normal set of line-breaking rules.

value.name: strict
value.desc: Breaks CJK scripts using a more restrictive set of line-breaking rules than 'normal'.

entry.name: -ms-overflow-style
entry.desc: Specify whether content is clipped when it overflows the element's content area.

value.name: auto
value.desc: No preference, UA should use the first scrolling method in the list that it supports.

value.name: -ms-autohiding-scrollbar
value.desc: Indicates the element displays auto-hiding scrollbars during mouse interactions and panning indicators during touch and keyboard interactions.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates the element does not display scrollbars or panning indicators, even when its content overflows.

value.name: scrollbar
value.desc: Scrollbars are typically narrow strips inserted on one or two edges of an element and which often have arrows to click on and a "thumb" to drag up and down (or left and right) to move the contents of the element.

entry.name: -ms-perspective
entry.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

value.name: none
value.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

entry.name: -ms-perspective-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: -ms-perspective-origin-x
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: -ms-perspective-origin-y
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: -ms-progress-appearance
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether a progress control displays as a bar or a ring.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-3dlight-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-arrow-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-base-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-darkshadow-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-face-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-highlight-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-shadow-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: -ms-scrollbar-track-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-chaining
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates the scrolling behavior that occurs when a user hits the content boundary during a manipulation.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit
entry.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-limit-x-min, -ms-scroll-limit-y-min, -ms-scroll-limit-x-max, and -ms-scroll-limit-y-max properties.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-max
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollLeft property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-x-min
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollLeft property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-max
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum value for the scrollTop property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-limit-y-min
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies the minimum value for the scrollTop property.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-rails
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether or not small motions perpendicular to the primary axis of motion will result in either changes to both the scrollTop and scrollLeft properties or a change to the primary axis (for instance, either the scrollTop or scrollLeft properties will change, but not both).

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-x
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the x-axis.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-points-y
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines where snap-points will be located along the y-axis.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-type
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that defines what type of snap-point should be used for the current element. There are two type of snap-points, with the primary difference being whether or not the user is guaranteed to always stop on a snap-point.

value.name: none
value.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container must ignore snap points, if any, when scrolled.

value.name: mandatory
value.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container is guaranteed to rest on a snap point when there are no active scrolling operations.

value.name: proximity
value.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container may come to rest on a snap point at the termination of a scroll at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-x
entry.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-x properties.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-snap-y
entry.desc: Gets or sets a shorthand value that sets values for the -ms-scroll-snap-type and -ms-scroll-snap-points-y properties.

entry.name: -ms-scroll-translation
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether vertical-to-horizontal scroll wheel translation occurs on the specified element.

entry.name: -ms-text-align-last
entry.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: -ms-text-autospace
entry.desc: Determines whether or not a full-width punctuation mark character should be trimmed if it appears at the beginning of a line, so that its 'ink' lines up with the first glyph in the line above and below.

value.name: ideograph-alpha
value.desc: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and non-ideographic letters, such as Latin-based, Cyrillic, Greek, Arabic or Hebrew.

value.name: ideograph-numeric
value.desc: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographic letters and numeric glyphs.

value.name: ideograph-parenthesis
value.desc: Creates extra spacing between normal (non wide) parenthesis and ideographs.

value.name: ideograph-space
value.desc: Extends the width of the space character while surrounded by ideographs.

value.name: none
value.desc: No extra space is created.

value.name: punctuation
value.desc: Creates extra non-breaking spacing around punctuation as required by language-specific typographic conventions.

entry.name: -ms-text-combine-horizontal
entry.desc: This property specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character.

value.name: all
value.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally all consecutive characters within the box such that they take up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

value.name: digits
value.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally each maximal sequence of consecutive ASCII digits (U+0030–U+0039) that has as many or fewer characters than the specified integer such that it takes up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

value.name: none
value.desc: No special processing.

entry.name: -ms-text-justify
entry.desc: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

value.name: distribute
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

value.name: inter-cluster
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in clustered scripts. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.

value.name: inter-ideograph
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at inter-graphemic boundaries in scripts that use no word spaces. This value is typically used for CJK languages.

value.name: inter-word
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or (sometimes) Korean.

value.name: kashida
value.desc: Justification primarily stretches Arabic and related scripts through the use of kashida or other calligraphic elongation.

value.name: none
value.desc: Justification is disabled.

value.name: trim
value.desc: Specifies that compression is preferred to expansion and enables the trimming of blank space in glyphs where allowed by typographic tradition.

entry.name: -ms-text-kashida-space
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the ratio of kashida expansion to white space expansion when justifying lines of text in the object.

entry.name: -ms-text-overflow
entry.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

value.name: clip
value.desc: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

value.name: ellipsis
value.desc: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

entry.name: -ms-text-size-adjust
entry.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

value.name: none
value.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

entry.name: -ms-text-underline-position
entry.desc: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements.This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the alphabetic baseline. In this case the underline is likely to cross some descenders.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline's position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

value.name: over
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the 'top' (right in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this mode, an overline also switches sides.

value.name: under
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the 'bottom' (left in vertical writing) edge of the element's em-box. In this case the underline usually does not cross the descenders. This is sometimes called 'accounting' underline.

entry.name: -ms-touch-action
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether and how a given region can be manipulated by the user.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element is a passive element, with several exceptions.

value.name: double-tap-zoom
value.desc: The element will zoom on double-tap.

value.name: manipulation
value.desc: The element is a manipulation-causing element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element is a manipulation-blocking element.

value.name: pan-x
value.desc: The element permits touch-driven panning on the horizontal axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

value.name: pan-y
value.desc: The element permits touch-driven panning on the vertical axis. The touch pan is performed on the nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

value.name: pinch-zoom
value.desc: The element permits pinch-zooming. The pinch-zoom is performed on the nearest ancestor with zoomable content.

entry.name: -ms-touch-select
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that toggles the 'gripper' visual elements that enable touch text selection.

value.name: grippers
value.desc: Grippers are always on.

value.name: none
value.desc: Grippers are always off.

entry.name: -ms-transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin-x
entry.desc: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin-y
entry.desc: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -ms-transform-origin-z
entry.desc: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -ms-user-select
entry.desc: Controls the appearance of selection.

entry.name: -ms-word-break
entry.desc: Specifies line break opportunities for non-CJK scripts.

value.name: break-all
value.desc: Lines may break between any two grapheme clusters for non-CJK scripts.

value.name: keep-all
value.desc: Block characters can no longer create implied break points.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.

entry.name: -ms-word-wrap
entry.desc: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit.

value.name: break-word
value.desc: An unbreakable 'word' may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

value.name: hyphenate
value.desc: An unbreakable 'word' may be hyphenated if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line even if hyphenation is turned off.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

entry.name: -ms-wrap-flow
entry.desc: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.

value.name: both
value.desc: Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.

value.name: clear
value.desc: Inline flow content can only wrap on top and bottom of the exclusion and must leave the areas to the start and end edges of the exclusion box empty.

value.name: end
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.

value.name: maximum
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the side of the exclusion with the largest available space for the given line, and must leave the other side of the exclusion empty.

value.name: minimum
value.desc: Inline flow content can flow around the edge of the exclusion with the smallest available space within the flow content’s containing block, and must leave the other edge of the exclusion empty.

value.name: start
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.

entry.name: -ms-wrap-margin
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that is used to offset the inner wrap shape from other shapes.

entry.name: -ms-wrap-through
entry.desc: Specifies if an element inherits its parent wrapping context. In other words if it is subject to the exclusions defined outside the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.

entry.name: -ms-writing-mode
entry.desc: Shorthand property for both 'direction' and 'block-progression'.

entry.name: -ms-zoom
entry.desc: Sets or retrieves the magnification scale of the object.

entry.name: -ms-zoom-animation
entry.desc: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether an animation is used when zooming.

entry.name: nav-down
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

value.name: current
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the frame that the element is in.

value.name: root
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the full window.

entry.name: nav-index
entry.desc: Provides an input-method-neutral way of specifying the sequential navigation order (also known as 'tabbing order').

value.name: auto
value.desc: The element's sequential navigation order is assigned automatically by the user agent.

entry.name: nav-left
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

value.name: current
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the frame that the element is in.

value.name: root
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the full window.

entry.name: nav-right
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

value.name: current
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the frame that the element is in.

value.name: root
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the full window.

entry.name: nav-up
entry.desc: Provides an way to control directional focus navigation.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent automatically determines which element to navigate the focus to in response to directional navigational input.

value.name: current
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the frame that the element is in.

value.name: root
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent should target the full window.

entry.name: negative
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Defines how to alter the representation when the counter value is negative.

entry.name: -o-animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -o-animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

entry.name: -o-animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -o-animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: -o-animation-fill-mode
entry.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

entry.name: -o-animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: -o-animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: -o-animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: -o-animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

entry.name: object-fit
entry.desc: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

value.name: contain
value.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element’s content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

value.name: cover
value.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element’s used width and height.

value.name: fill
value.desc: The replaced content is sized to fill the element’s content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

value.name: none
value.desc: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box

value.name: scale-down
value.desc: Size the content as if ‘none’ or ‘contain’ were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size.

entry.name: object-position
entry.desc: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.

entry.name: -o-border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: -o-object-fit
entry.desc: Specifies how the contents of a replaced element should be scaled relative to the box established by its used height and width.

value.name: contain
value.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting within the element’s content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a contain constraint against the element's used width and height.

value.name: cover
value.desc: The replaced content is sized to maintain its aspect ratio while filling the element's entire content box: its concrete object size is resolved as a cover constraint against the element’s used width and height.

value.name: fill
value.desc: The replaced content is sized to fill the element’s content box: the object's concrete object size is the element's used width and height.

value.name: none
value.desc: The replaced content is not resized to fit inside the element's content box

value.name: scale-down
value.desc: Size the content as if ‘none’ or ‘contain’ were specified, whichever would result in a smaller concrete object size.

entry.name: -o-object-position
entry.desc: Determines the alignment of the replaced element inside its box.

entry.name: opacity
entry.desc: Opacity of an element's text, where 1 is opaque and 0 is entirely transparent.

entry.name: order
entry.desc: Controls the order in which children of a flex container appear within the flex container, by assigning them to ordinal groups.

entry.name: orphans
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum number of line boxes in a block container that must be left in a fragment before a fragmentation break.

entry.name: -o-table-baseline
entry.desc: Determines which row of a inline-table should be used as baseline of inline-table.

entry.name: -o-tab-size
entry.desc: This property determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered.

entry.name: -o-text-overflow
entry.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping

value.name: clip
value.desc: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

value.name: ellipsis
value.desc: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

entry.name: -o-transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: -o-transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

entry.name: -o-transition
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -o-transition-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

entry.name: -o-transition-duration
entry.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

entry.name: -o-transition-property
entry.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -o-transition-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

entry.name: offset-block-end
entry.desc: Logical 'bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

entry.name: offset-block-start
entry.desc: Logical 'top'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

entry.name: offset-inline-end
entry.desc: Logical 'right'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

entry.name: offset-inline-start
entry.desc: Logical 'left'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well.

entry.name: orientation
entry.desc: @viewport descriptor. Used to request that a document is displayed in portrait or landscape mode.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA automatically chooses the orientation based on the device’s normal mode of operation.

value.name: landscape
value.desc: The document should be locked to landscape presentation.

value.name: portrait
value.desc: The document should be locked to portrait presentation.

entry.name: outline
entry.desc: Shorthand property for 'outline-style', 'outline-width', and 'outline-color'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style, typically the default platform style.

value.name: invert
value.desc: Performs a color inversion on the pixels on the screen.

entry.name: outline-color
entry.desc: The color of the outline.

value.name: invert
value.desc: Performs a color inversion on the pixels on the screen.

entry.name: outline-offset
entry.desc: Offset the outline and draw it beyond the border edge.

entry.name: outline-style
entry.desc: Style of the outline.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Permits the user agent to render a custom outline style, typically the default platform style.

entry.name: outline-width
entry.desc: Width of the outline.

entry.name: overflow
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'overflow-x' and 'overflow-y'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: clip
value.desc: Behaves as 'hidden' except forbids scrolling entirely, through any mechanism.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: -moz-hidden-unscrollable
value.desc: Same as the standardized 'clip', except doesn’t establish a block formatting context.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: overflow-wrap
entry.desc: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit within the line box.

value.name: break-word
value.desc: An otherwise unbreakable sequence of characters may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

entry.name: overflow-x
entry.desc: Specifies the handling of overflow in the horizontal direction.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: clip
value.desc: Behaves as 'hidden' except forbids scrolling entirely, through any mechanism.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: overflow-y
entry.desc: Specifies the handling of overflow in the vertical direction.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The behavior of the 'auto' value is UA-dependent, but should cause a scrolling mechanism to be provided for overflowing boxes.

value.name: clip
value.desc: Behaves as 'hidden' except forbids scrolling entirely, through any mechanism.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: Content is clipped and no scrolling mechanism should be provided to view the content outside the clipping region.

value.name: scroll
value.desc: Content is clipped and if the user agent uses a scrolling mechanism that is visible on the screen (such as a scroll bar or a panner), that mechanism should be displayed for a box whether or not any of its content is clipped.

value.name: visible
value.desc: Content is not clipped, i.e., it may be rendered outside the content box.

entry.name: pad
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a “fixed-width” counter style, where representations shorter than the pad value are padded with a particular <symbol>

entry.name: padding
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

value.name: logical
value.desc: Indicates that the values map to the logical properties instead of the physical ones.

entry.name: padding-bottom
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-block-end
entry.desc: Logical 'padding-bottom'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: padding-block-start
entry.desc: Logical 'padding-top'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: padding-inline-end
entry.desc: Logical 'padding-right'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: padding-inline-start
entry.desc: Logical 'padding-left'. Mapping depends on the parent element’s 'writing-mode', 'direction', and 'text-orientation'.

entry.name: padding-left
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-right
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: padding-top
entry.desc: Shorthand property to set values the thickness of the padding area. If left is omitted, it is the same as right. If bottom is omitted it is the same as top, if right is omitted it is the same as top. The value may not be negative.

entry.name: page
entry.desc: Specifies a particular type of page (called a named page) on which an element must be displayed.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Used value is the value specified on its nearest ancestor with a non-auto value.

entry.name: page-break-after
entry.desc: Defines rules for page breaks after an element.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break after generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page break after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: recto
value.desc: Equivalent to right in left-to-right page progressions and left in right-to-left page progressions.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

value.name: verso
value.desc: Equivalent to left in left-to-right page progressions and right in right-to-left page progressions.

entry.name: page-break-before
entry.desc: Defines rules for page breaks before an element.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break before the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page break before the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: page-break-inside
entry.desc: Defines rules for page breaks inside an element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

entry.name: page-policy
entry.desc: Determines which page-based occurrence of a given element is applied to a counter or string value.

value.name: first
value.desc: Takes the value after the first state change in the counter or string during processing of the page.

value.name: last
value.desc: Takes the value following the final state change on the page.

value.name: start
value.desc: Takes the value of the counter or string at the beginning of the page (before applying style to the elements of the page, but after applying it to the @page context itself).

entry.name: paint-order
entry.desc: Controls the order that the three paint operations that shapes and text are rendered with: their fill, their stroke and any markers they might have.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The element is painted with the standard order of painting operations: the 'fill' is painted first, then its 'stroke' and finally its markers.

entry.name: pause
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'pause-before' and 'pause-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'pause-before' and the second is 'pause-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

value.name: medium
value.desc: A medium pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Equivalent to 0ms.

value.name: strong
value.desc: A strong pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: weak
value.desc: A weak pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-strong
