value.desc: An extra strong pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-weak
value.desc: An extra weak pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

entry.name: pause-after
entry.desc: Specifies a pause or prosodic boundary to be observed after an element or, if any 'cue-after' is specified, after these. Values indicate the prosodic strength of the break in speech output.

value.name: medium
value.desc: A medium pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Equivalent to 0ms.

value.name: strong
value.desc: A strong pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: weak
value.desc: A weak pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-strong
value.desc: An extra strong pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-weak
value.desc: An extra weak pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

entry.name: pause-before
entry.desc: Specifies a pause or prosodic boundary to be observed before an element or, if any 'cue-before' is specified, before these. Values indicate the prosodic strength of the break in speech output.

value.name: medium
value.desc: A medium pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Equivalent to 0ms.

value.name: strong
value.desc: A strong pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: weak
value.desc: A weak pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-strong
value.desc: An extra strong pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-weak
value.desc: An extra weak pause in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

entry.name: perspective
entry.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

value.name: none
value.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

entry.name: perspective-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: pointer-events
entry.desc: Specifies under what circumstances a given element can be the target element for a pointer event.

value.name: all
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over either the interior or the perimeter of the element.

value.name: fill
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over the interior of the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The given element does not receive pointer events.

value.name: painted
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the pointer is over a "painted" area.

value.name: stroke
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events whenever the pointer is over the perimeter of the element.

value.name: visible
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the ‘visibility’ property is set to visible and the pointer is over either the interior or the perimete of the element.

value.name: visibleFill
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the ‘visibility’ property is set to visible and when the pointer is over the interior of the element.

value.name: visiblePainted
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the ‘visibility’ property is set to visible and when the pointer is over a ‘painted’ area.

value.name: visibleStroke
value.desc: The given element can be the target element for pointer events when the ‘visibility’ property is set to visible and when the pointer is over the perimeter of the element.

value.name: absolute
value.desc: The box's position (and possibly size) is specified with the 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties. These properties specify offsets with respect to the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: center
value.desc: Center positioned boxes are taken out of the normal flow. This means they have no impact on the layout of later siblings.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model, but in addition, the box is fixed with respect to some reference. As with the 'absolute' model, the box's margins do not collapse with any other margins.

value.name: -ms-page
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model.

value.name: page
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the 'absolute' model.

value.name: relative
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow (this is called the position in normal flow). Then the box is offset relative to its normal position.

value.name: static
value.desc: The box is a normal box, laid out according to the normal flow. The 'top', 'right', 'bottom', and 'left' properties do not apply.

value.name: sticky
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow. Then the box is offset relative to its flow root and containing block and in all cases, including table elements, does not affect the position of any following boxes.

value.name: -webkit-sticky
value.desc: The box's position is calculated according to the normal flow. Then the box is offset relative to its flow root and containing block and in all cases, including table elements, does not affect the position of any following boxes.

entry.name: prefix
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a <symbol> that is prepended to the marker representation.

entry.name: quotes
entry.desc: Specifies quotation marks for any number of embedded quotations.

value.name: none
value.desc: The 'open-quote' and 'close-quote' values of the 'content' property produce no quotations marks, as if they were 'no-open-quote' and 'no-close-quote' respectively.

entry.name: r
entry.desc: Describes the radius of the ‘circle’ element.

entry.name: range
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Defines the ranges over which the counter style is defined.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The range depends on the counter system.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: If used as the first value in a range, it represents negative infinity; if used as the second value, it represents positive infinity.

entry.name: region-fragment
entry.desc: Controls the behavior of the last region associated with a named flow.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Content flows as it would in a regular content box.

value.name: break
value.desc: If the content fits within the CSS Region, then this property has no effect.

entry.name: resize
entry.desc: Specifies whether or not an element is resizable by the user, and if so, along which axis/axes.

value.name: both
value.desc: The UA presents a bidirectional resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust both the height and the width of the element.

value.name: block
value.desc: Logical 'vertical'

value.name: horizontal
value.desc: The UA presents a unidirectional horizontal resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the width of the element.

value.name: inline
value.desc: Logical 'horizontal'

value.name: none
value.desc: The UA does not present a resizing mechanism on the element, and the user is given no direct manipulation mechanism to resize the element.

value.name: vertical
value.desc: The UA presents a unidirectional vertical resizing mechanism to allow the user to adjust only the height of the element.

entry.name: rest
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting 'rest-before' and 'rest-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'rest-before' and the second is 'rest-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

value.name: medium
value.desc: A medium rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Equivalent to 0ms.

value.name: strong
value.desc: A strong rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: weak
value.desc: A weak rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-strong
value.desc: An extra strong rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-weak
value.desc: An extra weak rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

entry.name: rest-after
entry.desc: Specifies a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed after an element’s content.

value.name: medium
value.desc: A medium rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Equivalent to 0ms.

value.name: strong
value.desc: A strong rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: weak
value.desc: A weak rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-strong
value.desc: An extra strong rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-weak
value.desc: An extra weak rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

entry.name: rest-before
entry.desc: Specifies a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed before an element’s content.

value.name: medium
value.desc: A medium rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: none
value.desc: Equivalent to 0ms.

value.name: strong
value.desc: A strong rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: weak
value.desc: A weak rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-strong
value.desc: An extra strong rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

value.name: x-weak
value.desc: An extra weak rest in speech output. The exact time is implementation-dependent.

entry.name: right
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's right margin edge is offset to the left of the right edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: rotation
entry.desc: Rotates a block-level element counterclockwise around the point given by 'rotation-point'.

entry.name: rotation-point
entry.desc: Pair of values that defines a point as an offset from the top left border edge. Initial value is 50% 50%.

entry.name: ruby-align
entry.syntax: auto | start | left | center | end | right | distribute-letter | distribute-space | line-edge
entry.desc: Specifies how text is distributed within the various ruby boxes when their contents do not exactly fill their respective boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent determines how the ruby contents are aligned. This is the initial value.

value.name: center
value.desc: The ruby content is centered within its box.

value.name: distribute-letter
value.desc: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the base, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the base, with the first and last ruby text glyphs lining up with the corresponding first and last base glyphs. If the width of the ruby text is at least the width of the base, then the letters of the base are evenly distributed across the width of the ruby text.

value.name: distribute-space
value.desc: If the width of the ruby text is smaller than that of the base, then the ruby text contents are evenly distributed across the width of the base, with a certain amount of white space preceding the first and following the last character in the ruby text. That amount of white space is normally equal to half the amount of inter-character space of the ruby text.

value.name: left
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

value.name: line-edge
value.desc: If the ruby text is not adjacent to a line edge, it is aligned as in 'auto'. If it is adjacent to a line edge, then it is still aligned as in auto, but the side of the ruby text that touches the end of the line is lined up with the corresponding edge of the base.

value.name: right
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the end edge of the base.

value.name: start
value.desc: The ruby text content is aligned with the start edge of the base.

value.name: space-between
value.desc: The ruby content expands as defined for normal text justification (as defined by 'text-justify'),

value.name: space-around
value.desc: As for 'space-between' except that there exists an extra justification opportunities whose space is distributed half before and half after the ruby content.

entry.name: ruby-overhang
entry.desc: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The ruby text can overhang text adjacent to the base on either side. This is the initial value.

value.name: end
value.desc: The ruby text can overhang the text that follows it.

value.name: none
value.desc: The ruby text cannot overhang any text adjacent to its base, only its own base.

value.name: start
value.desc: The ruby text can overhang the text that precedes it.

entry.name: ruby-position
entry.desc: Used by the parent of elements with display: ruby-text to control the position of the ruby text with respect to its base.

value.name: after
value.desc: The ruby text appears after the base. This is a relatively rare setting used in ideographic East Asian writing systems, most easily found in educational text.

value.name: before
value.desc: The ruby text appears before the base. This is the most common setting used in ideographic East Asian writing systems.

value.name: right
value.desc: The ruby text appears on the right of the base. Unlike 'before' and 'after', this value is not relative to the text flow direction.

entry.name: ruby-span
entry.desc: Determines whether, and on which side, ruby text is allowed to partially overhang any adjacent text in addition to its own base, when the ruby text is wider than the ruby base.

value.name: attr(x)
value.desc: The value of attribute 'x' is a string value. The string value is evaluated as a <number> to determine the number of ruby base elements to be spanned by the annotation element.

value.name: none
value.desc: No spanning. The computed value is '1'.

entry.name: rx
entry.desc: Describes the horizontal radius of the ‘ellipse’ element, and the curve radius of the 'rect' element.

entry.name: ry
entry.desc: Describes the vertical radius of the ‘ellipse’ element, and the curve radius of the 'rect' element.

entry.name: scrollbar-3dlight-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: scrollbar-arrow-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the arrow elements of a scroll arrow.

entry.name: scrollbar-base-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the main elements of a scroll bar, which include the scroll box, track, and scroll arrows.

entry.name: scrollbar-darkshadow-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.

entry.name: scrollbar-face-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: scrollbar-highlight-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: scrollbar-shadow-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.

entry.name: scrollbar-track-color
entry.desc: Determines the color of the track element of a scroll bar.

entry.name: scroll-behavior
entry.desc: Specifies the scrolling behavior for a scrolling box, when scrolling happens due to navigation or CSSOM scrolling APIs.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Scrolls in an instant fashion.

value.name: smooth
value.desc: Scrolls in a smooth fashion using a user-agent-defined timing function and time period.

entry.name: scroll-snap-coordinate
entry.desc: Defines the x and y coordinate within the element which will align with the nearest ancestor scroll container’s snap-destination for the respective axis.

value.name: none
value.desc: Specifies that this element does not contribute a snap point.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: Specifies the offset of the snap coordinate from the start edge of the element’s border box.

value.name: margin-box
value.desc: Specifies the offset of the snap coordinate from the start edge of the element’s margin box.

entry.name: scroll-snap-destination
entry.desc: Define the x and y coordinate within the scroll container’s visual viewport which element snap points will align with.

entry.name: scroll-snap-points-x
entry.desc: Defines the positioning of snap points along the x axis of the scroll container it is applied to.

value.name: none
value.desc: No snap points are defined by this scroll container.

value.name: repeat()
value.desc: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container’s relevant start edge.

entry.name: scroll-snap-points-y
entry.desc: Defines the positioning of snap points alobg the y axis of the scroll container it is applied to.

value.name: none
value.desc: No snap points are defined by this scroll container.

value.name: repeat()
value.desc: Defines an interval at which snap points are defined, starting from the container’s relevant start edge.

entry.name: scroll-snap-type
entry.desc: Defines how strictly snap points are enforced on the scroll container.

value.name: none
value.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container must ignore snap points, if any, when scrolled.

value.name: mandatory
value.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container is guaranteed to rest on a snap point when there are no active scrolling operations.

value.name: proximity
value.desc: The visual viewport of this scroll container may come to rest on a snap point at the termination of a scroll at the discretion of the UA given the parameters of the scroll.

entry.name: shape-image-threshold
entry.desc: Defines the alpha channel threshold used to extract the shape using an image. A value of 0.5 means that the shape will enclose all the pixels that are more than 50% opaque.

entry.name: shape-inside
entry.desc: Adds one or more exclusion areas to the element’s wrapping context.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The shape is computed based on the content box of the element.

value.name: display
value.desc: The shape is computed based on the shape of the display as described in css-round-display.

value.name: margin-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the margin box.

value.name: outside-shape
value.desc: The shape is computed based on the shape defined by the shape-outside and shape-margin properties.

value.name: url()
value.desc: If an SVG element it defines the shape. If an image, the shape is extracted and computed based on the alpha channel.

entry.name: shape-margin
entry.desc: Adds a margin to a 'shape-outside'. This defines a new shape that is the smallest contour that includes all the points that are the 'shape-margin' distance outward in the perpendicular direction from a point on the underlying shape.

entry.name: shape-outside
entry.desc: Specifies an orthogonal rotation to be applied to an image before it is laid out.

value.name: margin-box
value.desc: The background is painted within (clipped to) the margin box.

value.name: none
value.desc: The float area is unaffected.

entry.name: shape-padding
entry.desc: Adds padding to a 'shape-inside'.

entry.name: shape-rendering
entry.desc: Provides hints about what tradeoffs to make as it renders vector graphics elements such as <path> elements and basic shapes such as circles and rectangles.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Suppresses aural rendering.

value.name: crispEdges
value.desc: Emphasize the contrast between clean edges of artwork over rendering speed and geometric precision.

value.name: geometricPrecision
value.desc: Emphasize geometric precision over speed and crisp edges.

value.name: optimizeSpeed
value.desc: Emphasize rendering speed over geometric precision and crisp edges.

entry.name: speak
entry.desc: Specifies whether text will be rendered aurally and if so, in what manner.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Computed to 'none' if 'display' is 'none', otherwise 'auto'.

value.name: none
value.desc: Suppresses aural rendering.

value.name: normal
value.desc: The element is rendered aurally.

entry.name: speak-as
entry.desc: Determines in what manner text gets rendered aurally, based upon a basic predefined list of possibilities.

value.name: digits
value.desc: Speak numbers one digit at a time.

value.name: literal-punctuation
value.desc: Punctuation such as semicolons, braces, and so on is named aloud (i.e. spoken literally) rather than rendered naturally as appropriate pauses.

value.name: no-punctuation
value.desc: Punctuation is not rendered: neither spoken nor rendered as pauses.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Uses language-dependent pronunciation rules for rendering the element’s content.

value.name: spell-out
value.desc: Spells the text one letter at a time.

entry.name: src
entry.desc: @font-face descriptor. Specifies the resource containing font data. It is required, whether the font is downloadable or locally installed.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Reference font by URL

value.name: format()
value.desc: Optional hint describing the format of the font resource.

value.name: local()
value.desc: Format-specific string that identifies a locally available copy of a given font.

entry.name: stop-color
entry.desc: Indicates what color to use at that gradient stop.

entry.name: stop-opacity
entry.desc: Defines the opacity of a given gradient stop.

entry.name: stroke
entry.desc: Paints along the outline of the given graphical element.

value.name: child
value.desc: A reference to the last child paint server element of the element being painted.

value.name: child()
value.desc: A reference to the nth child paint server element of the element being painted.

value.name: context-fill
value.desc: The computed value of the ‘fill’ property of the context element of the element being painted.

value.name: context-stroke
value.desc: The computed value of the ‘stroke’ property of the context element of the element being painted.

value.name: url()
value.desc: A URL reference to a paint server element, which is an element that defines a paint server: ‘hatch’, ‘linearGradient’, ‘mesh’, ‘pattern’, ‘radialGradient’ and ‘solidcolor’.

value.name: none
value.desc: No paint is applied in this layer.

entry.name: stroke-dasharray
entry.desc: Controls the pattern of dashes and gaps used to stroke paths.

value.name: none
value.desc: Indicates that no dashing is used.

entry.name: stroke-dashoffset
entry.desc: Specifies the distance into the dash pattern to start the dash.

entry.name: stroke-linecap
entry.desc: Specifies the shape to be used at the end of open subpaths when they are stroked.

value.name: butt
value.desc: Indicates that the stroke for each subpath does not extend beyond its two endpoints.

value.name: round
value.desc: Indicates that at each end of each subpath, the shape representing the stroke will be extended by a half circle with a radius equal to the stroke width.

value.name: square
value.desc: Indicates that at the end of each subpath, the shape representing the stroke will be extended by a rectangle with the same width as the stroke width and whose length is half of the stroke width.

entry.name: stroke-linejoin
entry.desc: Specifies the shape to be used at the corners of paths or basic shapes when they are stroked.

value.name: arcs
value.desc: Indicates that an arcs corner is to be used to join path segments.

value.name: bevel
value.desc: Indicates that a bevelled corner is to be used to join path segments.

value.name: miter
value.desc: Indicates that a sharp corner is to be used to join path segments.

value.name: miter-clip
value.desc: Same as miter but if the ‘stroke-miterlimit’ is exceeded, the miter is clipped at a miter length equal to the ‘stroke-miterlimit’ value multiplied by the stroke width.

value.name: round
value.desc: Indicates that a round corner is to be used to join path segments.

entry.name: stroke-miterlimit
entry.desc: When two line segments meet at a sharp angle and miter joins have been specified for 'stroke-linejoin', it is possible for the miter to extend far beyond the thickness of the line stroking the path.

entry.name: stroke-opacity
entry.desc: Specifies the opacity of the painting operation used to stroke the current object.

entry.name: stroke-width
entry.desc: Specifies the width of the stroke on the current object.

entry.name: suffix
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies a <symbol> that is appended to the marker representation.

entry.name: system
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies which algorithm will be used to construct the counter’s representation based on the counter value.

value.name: additive
value.desc: Represents “sign-value” numbering systems, which, rather than using reusing digits in different positions to change their value, define additional digits with much larger values, so that the value of the number can be obtained by adding all the digits together.

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: Interprets the list of counter symbols as digits to an alphabetic numbering system, similar to the default lower-alpha counter style, which wraps from "a", "b", "c", to "aa", "ab", "ac".

value.name: cyclic
value.desc: Cycles repeatedly through its provided symbols, looping back to the beginning when it reaches the end of the list.

value.name: extends
value.desc: Use the algorithm of another counter style, but alter other aspects.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: Runs through its list of counter symbols once, then falls back.

value.name: numeric
value.desc: interprets the list of counter symbols as digits to a "place-value" numbering system, similar to the default 'decimal' counter style.

value.name: symbolic
value.desc: Cycles repeatedly through its provided symbols, doubling, tripling, etc. the symbols on each successive pass through the list.

entry.name: symbols
entry.desc: @counter-style descriptor. Specifies the symbols used by the marker-construction algorithm specified by the system descriptor.

entry.name: table-layout
entry.desc: Controls the algorithm used to lay out the table cells, rows, and columns.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Use any automatic table layout algorithm.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: Use the fixed table layout algorithm.

entry.name: tab-size
entry.desc: Determines the width of the tab character (U+0009), in space characters (U+0020), when rendered.

entry.name: text-align
entry.desc: Describes how inline contents of a block are horizontally aligned if the contents do not completely fill the line box.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: match-parent
value.desc: This value behaves the same as 'inherit' except that an inherited value of 'start' or 'end' is calculated against its parent's 'direction' value.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: text-align-last
entry.desc: Describes how the last line of a block or a line right before a forced line break is aligned when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Content on the affected line is aligned per 'text-align' unless 'text-align' is set to 'justify', in which case it is 'start-aligned'.

value.name: center
value.desc: The inline contents are centered within the line box.

value.name: end
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the end edge of the line box.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The text is justified according to the method specified by the 'text-justify' property.

value.name: left
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the left edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'left' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the start edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: right
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the right edge of the line box. In vertical text, 'right' aligns to the edge of the line box that would be the end edge for left-to-right text.

value.name: start
value.desc: The inline contents are aligned to the start edge of the line box.

entry.name: text-anchor
entry.desc: Used to align (start-, middle- or end-alignment) a string of text relative to a given point.

value.name: end
value.desc: The rendered characters are aligned such that the end of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

value.name: middle
value.desc: The rendered characters are aligned such that the geometric middle of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

value.name: start
value.desc: The rendered characters are aligned such that the start of the resulting rendered text is at the initial current text position.

entry.name: text-combine-upright
entry.desc: This property specifies the combination of multiple characters into the space of a single character.

value.name: all
value.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally all consecutive characters within the box such that they take up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

value.name: digits
value.desc: Attempt to typeset horizontally each maximal sequence of consecutive ASCII digits (U+0030–U+0039) that has as many or fewer characters than the specified integer such that it takes up the space of a single character within the vertical line box.

value.name: none
value.desc: No special processing.

entry.name: text-decoration
entry.desc: Decorations applied to font used for an element's text.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: Produces a dashed line style.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: Produces a dotted line.

value.name: double
value.desc: Produces a double line.

value.name: line-through
value.desc: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

value.name: none
value.desc: Produces no line.

value.name: overline
value.desc: Each line of text has a line above it.

value.name: solid
value.desc: Produces a solid line.

value.name: underline
value.desc: Each line of text is underlined.

value.name: wavy
value.desc: Produces a wavy line.

entry.name: text-decoration-color
entry.desc: Specifies the color of text decoration (underlines overlines, and line-throughs) set on the element with text-decoration-line.

entry.name: text-decoration-line
entry.desc: Specifies what line decorations, if any, are added to the element.

value.name: line-through
value.desc: Each line of text has a line through the middle.

value.name: none
value.desc: Neither produces nor inhibits text decoration.

value.name: overline
value.desc: Each line of text has a line above it.

value.name: underline
value.desc: Each line of text is underlined.

entry.name: text-decoration-skip
entry.desc: Specifies what parts of the element's content any text decoration affecting the element must skip over. It controls all text decoration lines drawn by the element and also any text decoration lines drawn by its ancestors.

value.name: box-decoration
value.desc: Skip over the box’s margin, border, and padding areas.

value.name: ink
value.desc: Skip over where glyphs are drawn: interrupt the decoration line to let text show through where the text decoration would otherwise cross over a glyph. The UA may also skip a small distance to either side of the glyph outline.

value.name: none
value.desc: Skip nothing: text-decoration is drawn for all text content and for inline replaced elements.

value.name: objects
value.desc: Skip this element if it is an atomic inline (such as an image or inline-block).

value.name: spaces
value.desc: Skip white space: this includes regular spaces (U+0020) and tabs (U+0009), as well as nbsp (U+00A0), ideographic space (U+3000), all fixed width spaces (such as U+2000–U+200A, U+202F and U+205F), and any adjacent letter-spacing or word-spacing.

entry.name: text-decoration-style
entry.desc: Specifies the line style for underline, line-through and overline text decoration.

value.name: dashed
value.desc: Produces a dashed line style.

value.name: dotted
value.desc: Produces a dotted line.

value.name: double
value.desc: Produces a double line.

value.name: none
value.desc: Produces no line.

value.name: solid
value.desc: Produces a solid line.

value.name: wavy
value.desc: Produces a wavy line.

entry.name: text-emphasis
entry.syntax: <color> | <string> | none | [ [ filled | open ] || [ dot | circle | double-circle | triangle | sesame ] ]
entry.desc: Shorthand for setting text-emphasis-style and text-emphasis-color in one declaration.

value.name: circle
value.desc: Draw large circles as marks. The filled circle is U+25CF '●', and the open circle is U+25CB '○'.

value.name: dot
value.desc: Draw small circles as marks. The filled dot is U+2022 '•', and the open dot is U+25E6 '◦'.

value.name: double-circle
value.desc: Draw double circles as marks. The filled double-circle is U+25C9 '◉', and the open double-circle is U+25CE '◎'.

value.name: filled
value.desc: The shape is filled with solid color.

value.name: none
value.desc: No emphasis marks.

value.name: open
value.desc: The shape is hollow.

value.name: sesame
value.desc: Draw sesames as marks. The filled sesame is U+FE45 '﹅', and the open sesame is U+FE46 '﹆'.

value.name: triangle
value.desc: Draw triangles as marks. The filled triangle is U+25B2 '▲', and the open triangle is U+25B3 '△'.

entry.name: text-emphasis-color
entry.desc: Describes the foreground color of the emphasis marks.

entry.name: text-emphasis-position
entry.desc: Describes where emphasis marks are drawn at.

value.name: over
value.desc: Draw marks over the text in horizontal typographic mode.

value.name: under
value.desc: Draw marks under the text in horizontal typographic mode.

value.name: left
value.desc: Draw marks to the left of the text in vertical typographic mode.

value.name: right
value.desc: Draw marks to the right of the text in vertical typographic mode.

entry.name: text-emphasis-style
entry.syntax: none | [[ filled | open ] || [ dot | circle | double-circle | triangle | sesame ]] | <string>
entry.desc: Applies emphasis marks to the element's text.

value.name: circle
value.desc: Draw large circles as marks. The filled circle is U+25CF '●', and the open circle is U+25CB '○'.

value.name: dot
value.desc: Draw small circles as marks. The filled dot is U+2022 '•', and the open dot is U+25E6 '◦'.

value.name: double-circle
value.desc: Draw double circles as marks. The filled double-circle is U+25C9 '◉', and the open double-circle is U+25CE '◎'.

value.name: filled
value.desc: The shape is filled with solid color.

value.name: none
value.desc: No emphasis marks.

value.name: open
value.desc: The shape is hollow.

value.name: sesame
value.desc: Draw sesames as marks. The filled sesame is U+FE45 '﹅', and the open sesame is U+FE46 '﹆'.

value.name: triangle
value.desc: Draw triangles as marks. The filled triangle is U+25B2 '▲', and the open triangle is U+25B3 '△'.

entry.name: text-indent
entry.desc: Specifies the indentation applied to lines of inline content in a block. The indentation only affects the first line of inline content in the block unless the 'hanging' keyword is specified, in which case it affects all lines except the first.

value.name: each-line
value.desc: Indentation affects the first line of the block container as well as each line after a forced line break, but does not affect lines after a text wrap break.

value.name: hanging
value.desc: Inverts which lines are affected.

entry.name: text-justify
entry.desc: Selects the justification algorithm used when 'text-align' is set to 'justify'. The property applies to block containers, but the UA may (but is not required to) also support it on inline elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The UA determines the justification algorithm to follow, based on a balance between performance and adequate presentation quality.

value.name: distribute
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing both at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in all scripts except those in the connected and cursive groups. This value is sometimes used in e.g. Japanese, often with the 'text-align-last' property.

value.name: inter-character
value.desc: Justification adjusts spacing between each pair of adjacent typographic character units.

value.name: inter-cluster
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at grapheme cluster boundaries in clustered scripts. This value is typically used for Southeast Asian scripts such as Thai.

value.name: inter-ideograph
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators and at inter-graphemic boundaries in scripts that use no word spaces. This value is typically used for CJK languages.

value.name: inter-word
value.desc: Justification primarily changes spacing at word separators. This value is typically used for languages that separate words using spaces, like English or (sometimes) Korean.

value.name: kashida
value.desc: Justification primarily stretches Arabic and related scripts through the use of kashida or other calligraphic elongation.

value.name: none
value.desc: Justification is disabled.

entry.name: text-orientation
entry.desc: Specifies the orientation of text within a line.

value.name: mixed
value.desc: In vertical writing modes, characters from horizontal-only scripts are set sideways, i.e. 90° clockwise from their standard orientation in horizontal text.

value.name: sideways
value.desc: This value is equivalent to 'sideways-right' in 'vertical-rl' writing mode and equivalent to 'sideways-left' in 'vertical-lr' writing mode.

value.name: sideways-left
value.desc: In vertical writing modes, this causes text to be set as if in a horizontal layout, but rotated 90° counter-clockwise.

value.name: sideways-right
value.desc: In vertical writing modes, this causes text to be set as if in a horizontal layout, but rotated 90° clockwise.

value.name: upright
value.desc: In vertical writing modes, characters from horizontal-only scripts are rendered upright, i.e. in their standard horizontal orientation.

value.name: use-glyph-orientation
value.desc: This value deprecated and only applies to SVG.

entry.name: text-overflow
entry.desc: Text can overflow for example when it is prevented from wrapping.

value.name: clip
value.desc: Clip inline content that overflows. Characters may be only partially rendered.

value.name: ellipsis
value.desc: Render an ellipsis character (U+2026) to represent clipped inline content.

entry.name: text-rendering
entry.desc: The creator of SVG content might want to provide a hint to the implementation about what tradeoffs to make as it renders text. The ‘text-rendering’ property provides these hints.

value.name: geometricPrecision
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize geometric precision over legibility and rendering speed.

value.name: optimizeLegibility
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize legibility over rendering speed and geometric precision.

value.name: optimizeSpeed
value.desc: Indicates that the user agent shall emphasize rendering speed over legibility and geometric precision.

entry.name: text-shadow
entry.desc: Enables shadow effects to be applied to the text of the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: No shadow.

entry.name: text-size-adjust
entry.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

value.name: none
value.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

entry.name: text-space-collapse
entry.desc: Declares whether and how white space inside the element is collapsed. Values have the following meanings, which must be interpreted according to the white space processing rules.

value.name: collapse
value.desc: Collapse sequences of white space into a single character

value.name: discard
value.desc: Discard all white space in the element.

value.name: preserve
value.desc: Prevents collapsing sequences of white space.

value.name: preserve-auto
value.desc: As 'preserve', but matches platform conventions for editable text fields.

value.name: preserve-trim
value.desc: As 'preserve', but collapse the advance widths of all preserved white space at the end of a line.

value.name: preserve-breaks
value.desc: Prevents collapsing sequences of white space, and converts tabs and segment breaks to spaces.

value.name: preserve-spaces
value.desc: Discard whitespace at the start and end of the element.

entry.name: text-space-trim
entry.desc: Specifies trimming behavior at the beginning and end of a box.

value.name: none
value.desc: Don’t discard whitepace.

value.name: trim-inner
value.desc: Discard whitespace at the start and end of the element.

value.name: discard-before
value.desc: Collapse all collapsible whitespace immediately before the start of the element.

value.name: discard-after
value.desc: Collapse all collapsible whitespace immediately after the end of the element.

entry.name: text-spacing
entry.desc: Controls spacing between adjacent characters on the same line within the same inline formatting context using a set of character-class-based rules.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Specifies the baseline behavior, equivalent to 'space-start allow-end trim-adjacent'.

value.name: none
value.desc: Turns off all text-spacing features. All fullwidth characters are set with full-width glyphs.

value.name: trim-start
value.desc: Set fullwidth opening punctuation with half-width glyphs (flush) at the start of each line.

value.name: space-start
value.desc: Set fullwidth opening punctuation with full-width glyphs (spaced) at the start of each line.

value.name: trim-end
value.desc: Set fullwidth closing punctuation with half-width glyphs (flush) at the end of each line.

value.name: space-end
value.desc: Set fullwidth opening punctuation with full-width glyphs (spaced) at the start of each line.

value.name: allow-end
value.desc: Set fullwidth closing punctuation with half-width glyphs (flush) at the end of each line if it does not otherwise fit prior to justification; otherwise set the punctuation with full-width glyphs.

value.name: trim-adjacent
value.desc: Collapse spacing between punctuation glyphs.

value.name: space-adjacent
value.desc: Set fullwidth opening punctuation with full-width glyphs (spaced) when not at the start of the line. Set fullwidth closing punctuation with full-width glyphs (spaced) when not at the end of the line.

value.name: no-compress
value.desc: Justification may not compress text-spacing.

value.name: ideograph-alpha
value.desc: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographs and non-ideographic letters.

value.name: ideograph-numeric
value.desc: Creates 1/4em extra spacing between runs of ideographs and non-ideographic numerals glyphs.

value.name: punctuation
value.desc: Creates extra non-breaking spacing around punctuation as required by language-specific typographic conventions.

entry.name: text-transform
entry.desc: Controls capitalization effects of an element’s text.

value.name: capitalize
value.desc: Puts the first typographic letter unit of each word in titlecase.

value.name: full-width
value.desc: Puts all characters in fullwidth form. If the character does not have corresponding fullwidth form, it is left as is.

value.name: lowercase
value.desc: Puts all letters in lowercase.

value.name: none
value.desc: No effects.

value.name: uppercase
value.desc: Puts all letters in uppercase.

entry.name: text-underline-position
entry.desc: Sets the position of an underline specified on the same element: it does not affect underlines specified by ancestor elements. This property is typically used in vertical writing contexts such as in Japanese documents where it often desired to have the underline appear 'over' (to the right of) the affected run of text

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent may use any algorithm to determine the underline’s position. In horizontal line layout, the underline should be aligned as for alphabetic. In vertical line layout, if the language is set to Japanese or Korean, the underline should be aligned as for over.

value.name: below
value.desc: The underline is aligned with the under edge of the element’s content box.

value.name: left
value.desc: In vertical typographic modes, the underline is aligned as for 'below', on the left edge of the text.

value.name: right
value.desc: In vertical typographic modes, the underline is aligned as for 'below', except it is aligned to the right edge of the text.

value.name: under
value.desc: The underline is positioned under the element’s text content.

entry.name: text-wrap
entry.desc: Specifies mode for text wrapping.

value.name: balance
value.desc: Same as normal for inline-level elements. For block-level elements that contain line boxes as direct children, line breaks are chosen to balance the inline-size those line boxes consume, if better balance than normal is possible.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Lines may break at allowed break points, as determined by the line-breaking rules in effect. Honors rules specified in Unicode Standard Annex #14 for the WJ, ZW, and GL line-breaking classes.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: Lines may not break; text that does not fit within the block container overflows it.

entry.name: top
entry.desc: Specifies how far an absolutely positioned box's top margin edge is offset below the top edge of the box's 'containing block'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For non-replaced elements, the effect of this value depends on which of related properties have the value 'auto' as well

entry.name: touch-action
entry.desc: Determines whether touch input may trigger default behavior supplied by user agent.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The user agent may determine any permitted touch behaviors for touches that begin on the element.

value.name: manipulation
value.desc: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of scrolling and continuous zooming.

value.name: none
value.desc: Touches that begin on the element must not trigger default touch behaviors.

value.name: pan-x
value.desc: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of horizontally scrolling the element’s nearest ancestor with horizontally scrollable content.

value.name: pan-y
value.desc: The user agent may consider touches that begin on the element only for the purposes of vertically scrolling the element’s nearest ancestor with vertically scrollable content.

entry.name: transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: perspective()
value.desc: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: transform-box
entry.desc: All transformations defined by the 'transform' and 'transform-origin' property are relative to the position and dimension of the specified reference box.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: Uses the border box as reference box.

value.name: fill-box
value.desc: Uses the object bounding box as reference box.

value.name: view-box
value.desc: Uses the nearest SVG viewport as reference box.

entry.name: transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

entry.name: transform-style
entry.desc: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

value.name: flat
value.desc: All children of this element are rendered flattened into the 2D plane of the element.

value.name: preserve-3d
value.desc: Flattening is not performed, so children maintain their position in 3D space.

entry.name: transition
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: transition-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

entry.name: transition-duration
entry.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

entry.name: transition-property
entry.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: transition-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

entry.name: unicode-bidi
entry.desc: The level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm.

value.name: bidi-override
value.desc: Inside the element, reordering is strictly in sequence according to the 'direction' property; the implicit part of the bidirectional algorithm is ignored.

value.name: embed
value.desc: If the element is inline-level, this value opens an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. The direction of this embedding level is given by the 'direction' property.

value.name: isolate
value.desc: The contents of the element are considered to be inside a separate, independent paragraph.

value.name: isolate-override
value.desc: This combines the isolation behavior of 'isolate' with the directional override behavior of 'bidi-override'

value.name: normal
value.desc: The element does not open an additional level of embedding with respect to the bidirectional algorithm. For inline-level elements, implicit reordering works across element boundaries.

value.name: plaintext
value.desc: For the purposes of the Unicode bidirectional algorithm, the base directionality of each bidi paragraph for which the element forms the containing block is determined not by the element's computed 'direction'.

entry.name: unicode-range
entry.desc: @font-face descriptor. Defines the set of Unicode codepoints that may be supported by the font face for which it is declared.

value.name: U+26
value.desc: Ampersand.

value.name: U+20-24F, U+2B0-2FF, U+370-4FF, U+1E00-1EFF, U+2000-20CF, U+2100-23FF, U+2500-26FF, U+E000-F8FF, U+FB00–FB4F
value.desc: WGL4 character set (Pan-European).

value.name: U+20-17F, U+2B0-2FF, U+2000-206F, U+20A0-20CF, U+2100-21FF, U+2600-26FF
value.desc: The Multilingual European Subset No. 1. Latin. Covers ~44 languages.

value.name: U+20-2FF, U+370-4FF, U+1E00-20CF, U+2100-23FF, U+2500-26FF, U+FB00-FB4F, U+FFF0-FFFD
value.desc: The Multilingual European Subset No. 2. Latin, Greek, and Cyrillic. Covers ~128 language.

value.name: U+20-4FF, U+530-58F, U+10D0-10FF, U+1E00-23FF, U+2440-245F, U+2500-26FF, U+FB00-FB4F, U+FE20-FE2F, U+FFF0-FFFD
value.desc: The Multilingual European Subset No. 3. Covers all characters belonging to European scripts.

value.name: U+00-7F
value.desc: Basic Latin (ASCII).

value.name: U+80-FF
value.desc: Latin-1 Supplement. Accented characters for Western European languages, common punctuation characters, multiplication and division signs.

value.name: U+100-17F
value.desc: Latin Extended-A. Accented characters for for Czech, Dutch, Polish, and Turkish.

value.name: U+180-24F
value.desc: Latin Extended-B. Croatian, Slovenian, Romanian, Non-European and historic latin, Khoisan, Pinyin, Livonian, Sinology.

value.name: U+1E00-1EFF
value.desc: Latin Extended Additional. Vietnamese, German captial sharp s, Medievalist, Latin general use.

value.name: U+250-2AF
value.desc: International Phonetic Alphabet Extensions.

value.name: U+370-3FF
value.desc: Greek and Coptic.

value.name: U+1F00-1FFF
value.desc: Greek Extended. Accented characters for polytonic Greek.

value.name: U+400-4FF
value.desc: Cyrillic.

value.name: U+500-52F
value.desc: Cyrillic Supplement. Extra letters for Komi, Khanty, Chukchi, Mordvin, Kurdish, Aleut, Chuvash, Abkhaz, Azerbaijani, and Orok.

value.name: U+00-52F, U+1E00-1FFF, U+2200–22FF
value.desc: Latin, Greek, Cyrillic, some punctuation and symbols.

value.name: U+530–58F
value.desc: Armenian.

value.name: U+590–5FF
value.desc: Hebrew.

value.name: U+600–6FF
value.desc: Arabic.

value.name: U+750–77F
value.desc: Arabic Supplement. Additional letters for African languages, Khowar, Torwali, Burushaski, and early Persian.

value.name: U+8A0–8FF
value.desc: Arabic Extended-A. Additional letters for African languages, European and Central Asian languages, Rohingya, Berber, Arwi, and Koranic annotation signs.

value.name: U+700–74F
