entry.name: user-select
entry.desc: Controls the appearance of selection.

value.name: all
value.desc: The content of the element must be selected atomically

value.name: contain
value.desc: UAs must not allow a selection which is started in this element to be extended outside of this element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The UA must not allow selections to be started in this element.

value.name: text
value.desc: The element imposes no constraint on the selection.

entry.name: user-zoom
entry.desc: @viewport descriptor. Specifies if the zoom factor can be changed by user interaction or not.

value.name: fixed
value.desc: The user cannot interactively change the zoom factor.

value.name: zoom
value.desc: The user can interactively change the zoom factor.

entry.name: vector-effect
entry.desc: Affects the vertical positioning of the inline boxes generated by an inline-level element inside a line box.

value.name: fixed-position
value.desc: The placement of local coordinate system is fixed in spite of change of CTMs from a host coordinate space.

value.name: none
value.desc: Specifies that no vector effect shall be applied.

value.name: non-rotation
value.desc: The rotation and skew of the local coordinate system is suppressd in spite of change of CTMs from a host coordinate space.

value.name: non-scaling-size
value.desc: The scale of the local coordinate system do not change in spite of change of CTMs from a host coordinate space.

value.name: non-scaling-stroke
value.desc: Modifies the way an object is stroked. Stroke outline shall be calculated in the “host” coordinate space instead of local coordinate system.

value.name: screen
value.desc: Specifies the coordinate system of content which is under the immediate control of the user agent.

value.name: viewport
value.desc: Specifies immediate viewport coordinate system as the host coordinate space.

entry.name: vertical-align
entry.desc: Affects the vertical positioning of the inline boxes generated by an inline-level element inside a line box.

value.name: alphabetic
value.desc: Match the box’s alphabetic baseline to that of its parent.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Align the dominant baseline of the parent box with the equivalent, or heuristically reconstructed, baseline of the element inline box.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: Align the 'alphabetic' baseline of the element with the 'alphabetic' baseline of the parent element.

value.name: bottom
value.desc: Align the after edge of the extended inline box with the after-edge of the line box.

value.name: center
value.desc: Align the center of the aligned subtree with the center of the line box.

value.name: central
value.desc: Align the 'central' baseline of the inline element with the central baseline of the parent.

value.name: mathematical
value.desc: Match the box’s mathematical baseline to that of its parent.

value.name: middle
value.desc: Align the 'middle' baseline of the inline element with the middle baseline of the parent.

value.name: sub
value.desc: Lower the baseline of the box to the proper position for subscripts of the parent's box. (This value has no effect on the font size of the element's text.)

value.name: super
value.desc: Raise the baseline of the box to the proper position for superscripts of the parent's box. (This value has no effect on the font size of the element's text.)

value.name: text-bottom
value.desc: Align the bottom of the box with the after-edge of the parent element's font.

value.name: text-top
value.desc: Align the top of the box with the before-edge of the parent element's font.

value.name: top
value.desc: Align the before edge of the extended inline box with the before-edge of the line box.

entry.name: visibility
entry.desc: Specifies whether the boxes generated by an element are rendered. Invisible boxes still affect layout (set the ‘display’ property to ‘none’ to suppress box generation altogether).

value.name: collapse
value.desc: Table-specific. If used on elements other than rows, row groups, columns, or column groups, 'collapse' has the same meaning as 'hidden'.

value.name: hidden
value.desc: The generated box is invisible (fully transparent, nothing is drawn), but still affects layout.

value.name: visible
value.desc: The generated box is visible.

entry.name: voice-balance
entry.desc: Controls the spatial distribution of audio output across a lateral sound stage.

value.name: center
value.desc: Same as '0'.

value.name: left
value.desc: Same as '-100'.

value.name: leftwards
value.desc: Moves the sound to the left, by subtracting 20 from the inherited ‘voice-balance’ value, and by clamping the resulting number to ‘-100’.

value.name: right
value.desc: Same as '100'.

value.name: rightwards
value.desc: Moves the sound to the right, by adding 20 to the inherited ‘voice-balance’ value, and by clamping the resulting number to ‘100’.

entry.name: voice-duration
entry.desc: Specifies how long it should take to render the selected element's content (not including audio cues, pauses and rest).

value.name: auto
value.desc: Resolves to a used value corresponding to the duration of the speech synthesis when using the inherited ‘voice-rate’.

entry.name: voice-family
entry.desc: Comma-separated, prioritized list of voice family names (compare with 'font-family').

value.name: child
value.desc: Child voice for 'age'.

value.name: female
value.desc: Female voice for 'generic-voice'.

value.name: male
value.desc: Male voice for 'generic-voice'.

value.name: neutral
value.desc: Neutral voice for 'generic-voice'.

value.name: old
value.desc: Old person voice for 'age'.

value.name: preserve
value.desc: Indicates that the ‘voice-family’ value gets inherited and used regardless of any potential language change within the markup.

value.name: young
value.desc: Young person voice for 'age'.

entry.name: voice-pitch
entry.desc: Specifies the average pitch (a frequency) of the speaking voice. The average pitch of a voice depends on the voice family. For example, the average pitch for a standard male voice is around 120Hz, but for a female voice, it's around 210Hz.

value.name: absolute
value.desc: Indicates that the specified frequency represents an absolute value.

value.name: high
value.desc: High pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: low
value.desc: Low pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: medium
value.desc: Medium pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: x-high
value.desc: Extra High pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: x-low
value.desc: Extra low pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

entry.name: voice-range
entry.desc: Specifies the variability in the “baseline” pitch, i.e. how much the fundamental frequency may deviate from the average pitch of the speech output.

value.name: absolute
value.desc: Indicates that the specified frequency represents an absolute value.

value.name: high
value.desc: High pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: low
value.desc: Low pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: medium
value.desc: Medium pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: x-high
value.desc: Extra High pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

value.name: x-low
value.desc: Extra low pitch. Exact level is implementation and voice specific.

entry.name: voice-rate
entry.desc: Controls the speaking rate. The default rate for a voice depends on the language and dialect and on the personality of the voice.

value.name: medium
value.desc: Equivalent to 100% and means the normal rate for this voice.

entry.name: voice-stress
entry.desc: Indicates the strength of emphasis to be applied. Emphasis is indicated using a combination of pitch change, timing changes, loudness and other acoustic differences) that varies from one language to the next.

value.name: moderate
value.desc: Monotonically non-decreasing in strength. More emphasis than what the speech synthesizer would normally produce.

value.name: none
value.desc: Inhibits the synthesizer from emphasizing words it would normally emphasize.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Represents the default emphasis produced by the speech synthesizer.

value.name: reduced
value.desc: Effectively the opposite of emphasizing a word.

value.name: strong
value.desc: Monotonically non-decreasing in strength. More emphasis than what the speech synthesizer would normally produce.

entry.name: voice-volume
entry.syntax: <decibel> | silent | x-soft | soft | medium | loud | x-loud
entry.desc: Controls the amplitude of the audio waveform generated by the speech synthesiser.

value.name: loud
value.desc: Intermediary value between 'meduyn and 'x-loud'.

value.name: medium
value.desc: The user's preferred volume level.

value.name: silent
value.desc: Specifies that no sound is generated.

value.name: soft
value.desc: Intermediary value between 'x-soft' and 'medium'.

value.name: x-loud
value.desc: The user’s maximum tolerable volume level.

value.name: x-soft
value.desc: The user’s minimum audible volume level.

entry.name: -webkit-animation
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines six of the animation properties into a single property.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the animation will start.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-direction
entry.desc: Defines whether or not the animation should play in reverse on alternate cycles.

value.name: alternate
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the normal direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a reverse direction.

value.name: alternate-reverse
value.desc: The animation cycle iterations that are odd counts are played in the reverse direction, and the animation cycle iterations that are even counts are played in a normal direction.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Normal playback.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: All iterations of the animation are played in the reverse direction from the way they were specified.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-duration
entry.desc: Defines the length of time that an animation takes to complete one cycle.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-fill-mode
entry.desc: Defines what values are applied by the animation outside the time it is executing.

value.name: backwards
value.desc: The beginning property value (as defined in the first @keyframes at-rule) is applied before the animation is displayed, during the period defined by 'animation-delay'.

value.name: both
value.desc: Both forwards and backwards fill modes are applied.

value.name: forwards
value.desc: The final property value (as defined in the last @keyframes at-rule) is maintained after the animation completes.

value.name: none
value.desc: There is no change to the property value between the time the animation is applied and the time the animation begins playing or after the animation completes.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-iteration-count
entry.desc: Defines the number of times an animation cycle is played. The default value is one, meaning the animation will play from beginning to end once.

value.name: infinite
value.desc: Causes the animation to repeat forever.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-name
entry.desc: Defines a list of animations that apply. Each name is used to select the keyframe at-rule that provides the property values for the animation.

value.name: none
value.desc: No animation is performed

entry.name: -webkit-animation-play-state
entry.desc: Defines whether the animation is running or paused.

value.name: paused
value.desc: A running animation will be paused.

value.name: running
value.desc: Resume playback of a paused animation.

entry.name: -webkit-animation-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the animation will progress over one cycle of its duration. See the 'transition-timing-function'.

entry.name: -webkit-appearance
entry.desc: Changes the appearance of buttons and other controls to resemble native controls.

entry.name: -webkit-backdrop-filter
entry.desc: Applies a filter effect where the first filter in the list takes the element's background image as the input image.

value.name: none
value.desc: No filter effects are applied.

value.name: blur()
value.desc: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

value.name: brightness()
value.desc: Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.

value.name: contrast()
value.desc: Adjusts the contrast of the input.

value.name: drop-shadow()
value.desc: Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.

value.name: grayscale()
value.desc: Converts the input image to grayscale.

value.name: hue-rotate()
value.desc: Applies a hue rotation on the input image.

value.name: invert()
value.desc: Inverts the samples in the input image.

value.name: opacity()
value.desc: Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.

value.name: saturate()
value.desc: Saturates the input image.

value.name: sepia()
value.desc: Converts the input image to sepia.

value.name: url()
value.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

entry.name: -webkit-backface-visibility
entry.desc: Determines whether or not the 'back' side of a transformed element is visible when facing the viewer. With an identity transform, the front side of an element faces the viewer.

entry.name: -webkit-background-clip
entry.desc: Determines the background painting area.

entry.name: -webkit-background-origin
entry.desc: For elements rendered as a single box, specifies the background positioning area. For elements rendered as multiple boxes (e.g., inline boxes on several lines, boxes on several pages) specifies which boxes 'box-decoration-break' operates on to determine the background positioning area(s).

entry.name: -webkit-border-image
entry.desc: Shorthand property for setting 'border-image-source', 'border-image-slice', 'border-image-width', 'border-image-outset' and 'border-image-repeat'. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

value.name: auto
value.desc: If 'auto' is specified then the border image width is the intrinsic width or height (whichever is applicable) of the corresponding image slice. If the image does not have the required intrinsic dimension then the corresponding border-width is used instead.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Causes the middle part of the border-image to be preserved.

value.name: repeat
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area.

value.name: round
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the image is rescaled so that it does.

value.name: space
value.desc: The image is tiled (repeated) to fill the area. If it does not fill the area with a whole number of tiles, the extra space is distributed around the tiles.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The image is stretched to fill the area.

entry.name: -webkit-box-align
entry.desc: Specifies the alignment of nested elements within an outer flexible box element.

value.name: baseline
value.desc: If this box orientation is inline-axis or horizontal, all children are placed with their baselines aligned, and extra space placed before or after as necessary. For block flows, the baseline of the first non-empty line box located within the element is used. For tables, the baseline of the first cell is used.

value.name: center
value.desc: Any extra space is divided evenly, with half placed above the child and the other half placed after the child.

value.name: end
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element. For reverse direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element.

value.name: start
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the top edge of each child is placed along the top of the box. Extra space is placed below the element. For reverse direction boxes, the bottom edge of each child is placed along the bottom of the box. Extra space is placed above the element.

value.name: stretch
value.desc: The height of each child is adjusted to that of the containing block.

entry.name: -webkit-box-direction
entry.desc: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-direction specifies whether a box lays out its contents normally (from the top or left edge), or in reverse (from the bottom or right edge).

value.name: normal
value.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from left to right. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from top to bottom.

value.name: reverse
value.desc: A box with a computed value of horizontal for box-orient displays its children from right to left. A box with a computed value of vertical displays its children from bottom to top.

entry.name: -webkit-box-flex
entry.desc: Specifies an element's flexibility.

entry.name: -webkit-box-flex-group
entry.desc: Flexible elements can be assigned to flex groups using the 'box-flex-group' property.

entry.name: -webkit-box-ordinal-group
entry.desc: Indicates the ordinal group the element belongs to. Elements with a lower ordinal group are displayed before those with a higher ordinal group.

entry.name: -webkit-box-orient
entry.desc: In webkit applications, -webkit-box-orient specifies whether a box lays out its contents horizontally or vertically.

value.name: block-axis
value.desc: Elements are oriented along the box's axis.

value.name: horizontal
value.desc: The box displays its children from left to right in a horizontal line.

value.name: inline-axis
value.desc: Elements are oriented vertically.

value.name: vertical
value.desc: The box displays its children from stacked from top to bottom vertically.

entry.name: -webkit-box-pack
entry.desc: Specifies alignment of child elements within the current element in the direction of orientation.

value.name: center
value.desc: The extra space is divided evenly, with half placed before the first child and the other half placed after the last child.

value.name: end
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child. For reverse direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child.

value.name: justify
value.desc: The space is divided evenly in-between each child, with none of the extra space placed before the first child or after the last child. If there is only one child, treat the pack value as if it were start.

value.name: start
value.desc: For normal direction boxes, the left edge of the first child is placed at the left side, with all extra space placed after the last child. For reverse direction boxes, the right edge of the last child is placed at the right side, with all extra space placed before the first child.

entry.name: -webkit-box-reflect
entry.desc: Defines a reflection of a border box.

value.name: above
value.desc: The reflection appears above the border box.

value.name: below
value.desc: The reflection appears below the border box.

value.name: left
value.desc: The reflection appears to the left of the border box.

value.name: right
value.desc: The reflection appears to the right of the border box.

entry.name: -webkit-box-sizing
entry.desc: Box Model addition in CSS3.

value.name: border-box
value.desc: The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) on this element determine the border box of the element.

value.name: content-box
value.desc: Behavior of width and height as specified by CSS2.1. The specified width and height (and respective min/max properties) apply to the width and height respectively of the content box of the element.

entry.name: -webkit-break-after
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: -webkit-break-before
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: -webkit-break-inside
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior inside the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

entry.name: -webkit-column-break-after
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: -webkit-column-break-before
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior before the generated box.

value.name: always
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: column
value.desc: Always force a column break before/after the generated box.

value.name: left
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a left page.

value.name: page
value.desc: Always force a page break before/after the generated box.

value.name: right
value.desc: Force one or two page breaks before/after the generated box so that the next page is formatted as a right page.

entry.name: -webkit-column-break-inside
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior inside the generated box.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Neither force nor forbid a page/column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Avoid a page/column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid-column
value.desc: Avoid a column break inside the generated box.

value.name: avoid-page
value.desc: Avoid a page break inside the generated box.

entry.name: -webkit-column-count
entry.desc: Describes the optimal number of columns into which the content of the element will be flowed.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Determines the number of columns by the 'column-width' property and the element width.

entry.name: -webkit-column-gap
entry.desc: Sets the gap between columns. If there is a column rule between columns, it will appear in the middle of the gap.

value.name: normal
value.desc: User agent specific and typically equivalent to 1em.

entry.name: -webkit-column-rule
entry.desc: This property is a shorthand for setting 'column-rule-width', 'column-rule-style', and 'column-rule-color' at the same place in the style sheet. Omitted values are set to their initial values.

entry.name: -webkit-column-rule-color
entry.desc: Sets the color of the column rule

entry.name: -webkit-column-rule-style
entry.desc: Sets the style of the rule between columns of an element.

entry.name: -webkit-column-rule-width
entry.desc: Sets the width of the rule between columns. Negative values are not allowed.

entry.name: -webkit-columns
entry.desc: A shorthand property which sets both 'column-width' and 'column-count'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: -webkit-column-span
entry.desc: Describes the page/column break behavior after the generated box.

value.name: all
value.desc: The element spans across all columns. Content in the normal flow that appears before the element is automatically balanced across all columns before the element appear.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element does not span multiple columns.

entry.name: -webkit-column-width
entry.desc: This property describes the width of columns in multicol elements.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

entry.name: -webkit-filter
entry.desc: Processes an element’s rendering before it is displayed in the document, by applying one or more filter effects.

value.name: none
value.desc: No filter effects are applied.

value.name: blur()
value.desc: Applies a Gaussian blur to the input image.

value.name: brightness()
value.desc: Applies a linear multiplier to input image, making it appear more or less bright.

value.name: contrast()
value.desc: Adjusts the contrast of the input.

value.name: drop-shadow()
value.desc: Applies a drop shadow effect to the input image.

value.name: grayscale()
value.desc: Converts the input image to grayscale.

value.name: hue-rotate()
value.desc: Applies a hue rotation on the input image.

value.name: invert()
value.desc: Inverts the samples in the input image.

value.name: opacity()
value.desc: Applies transparency to the samples in the input image.

value.name: saturate()
value.desc: Saturates the input image.

value.name: sepia()
value.desc: Converts the input image to sepia.

value.name: url()
value.desc: A filter reference to a <filter> element.

entry.name: -webkit-flow-from
entry.desc: Makes a block container a region and associates it with a named flow.

value.name: none
value.desc: The block container is not a CSS Region.

entry.name: -webkit-flow-into
entry.desc: Places an element or its contents into a named flow.

value.name: none
value.desc: The element is not moved to a named flow and normal CSS processing takes place.

entry.name: -webkit-font-feature-settings
entry.desc: This property provides low-level control over OpenType font features. It is intended as a way of providing access to font features that are not widely used but are needed for a particular use case.

value.name: normal
value.desc: No change in glyph substitution or positioning occurs.

entry.name: -webkit-hyphens
entry.desc: Controls whether hyphenation is allowed to create more break opportunities within a line of text.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Conditional hyphenation characters inside a word, if present, take priority over automatic resources when determining hyphenation points within the word.

value.name: manual
value.desc: Words are only broken at line breaks where there are characters inside the word that suggest line break opportunities

value.name: none
value.desc: Words are not broken at line breaks, even if characters inside the word suggest line break points.

entry.name: -webkit-line-break
entry.desc: Specifies line-breaking rules for CJK (Chinese, Japanese, and Korean) text.

entry.name: -webkit-mask-clip
entry.desc: Determines the mask painting area, which determines the area that is affected by the mask.

entry.name: -webkit-mask-image
entry.desc: Sets the mask layer image of an element.

value.name: none
value.desc: Counts as a transparent black image layer.

value.name: url()
value.desc: Reference to a <mask element or to a CSS image.

entry.name: -webkit-mask-origin
entry.desc: Specifies the mask positioning area.

entry.name: -webkit-mask-repeat
entry.desc: Specifies how mask layer images are tiled after they have been sized and positioned.

entry.name: -webkit-mask-size
entry.desc: Specifies the size of the mask layer images.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Resolved by using the image’s intrinsic ratio and the size of the other dimension, or failing that, using the image’s intrinsic size, or failing that, treating it as 100%.

value.name: contain
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the largest size such that both its width and its height can fit inside the background positioning area.

value.name: cover
value.desc: Scale the image, while preserving its intrinsic aspect ratio (if any), to the smallest size such that both its width and its height can completely cover the background positioning area.

entry.name: -webkit-nbsp-mode
entry.desc: Defines the behavior of nonbreaking spaces within text.

entry.name: -webkit-overflow-scrolling
entry.desc: Specifies whether to use native-style scrolling in an overflow:scroll element.

entry.name: -webkit-perspective
entry.desc: Applies the same transform as the perspective(<number>) transform function, except that it applies only to the positioned or transformed children of the element, not to the transform on the element itself.

value.name: none
value.desc: No perspective transform is applied.

entry.name: -webkit-perspective-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin for the perspective property. It effectively sets the X and Y position at which the viewer appears to be looking at the children of the element.

entry.name: -webkit-region-fragment
entry.desc: The 'region-fragment' property controls the behavior of the last region associated with a named flow.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Content flows as it would in a regular content box.

value.name: break
value.desc: If the content fits within the CSS Region, then this property has no effect.

entry.name: -webkit-text-size-adjust
entry.desc: Specifies a size adjustment for displaying text content in mobile browsers.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Renderers must use the default size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

value.name: none
value.desc: Renderers must not do size adjustment when displaying on a small device.

entry.name: -webkit-transform
entry.desc: A two-dimensional transformation is applied to an element through the 'transform' property. This property contains a list of transform functions similar to those allowed by SVG.

value.name: matrix()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D transformation in the form of a transformation matrix of six values. matrix(a,b,c,d,e,f) is equivalent to applying the transformation matrix [a b c d e f]

value.name: matrix3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D transformation as a 4x4 homogeneous matrix of 16 values in column-major order.

value.name: perspective()
value.desc: Specifies a perspective projection matrix.

value.name: rotate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D rotation by the angle specified in the parameter about the origin of the element, as defined by the transform-origin property.

value.name: rotate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise 3D rotation by the angle specified in last parameter about the [x,y,z] direction vector described by the first 3 parameters.

value.name: rotateX('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the X axis.

value.name: rotateY('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Y axis.

value.name: rotateZ('angle')
value.desc: Specifies a clockwise rotation by the given angle about the Z axis.

value.name: scale()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D scale operation by the [sx,sy] scaling vector described by the 2 parameters. If the second parameter is not provided, it is takes a value equal to the first.

value.name: scale3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D scale operation by the [sx,sy,sz] scaling vector described by the 3 parameters.

value.name: scaleX()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sx,1] scaling vector, where sx is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleY()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [sy,1] scaling vector, where sy is given as the parameter.

value.name: scaleZ()
value.desc: Specifies a scale operation using the [1,1,sz] scaling vector, where sz is given as the parameter.

value.name: skew()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X and Y axes. The first angle parameter specifies the skew on the X axis. The second angle parameter specifies the skew on the Y axis. If the second parameter is not given then a value of 0 is used for the Y angle (ie: no skew on the Y axis).

value.name: skewX()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the X axis by the given angle.

value.name: skewY()
value.desc: Specifies a skew transformation along the Y axis by the given angle.

value.name: translate()
value.desc: Specifies a 2D translation by the vector [tx, ty], where tx is the first translation-value parameter and ty is the optional second translation-value parameter.

value.name: translate3d()
value.desc: Specifies a 3D translation by the vector [tx,ty,tz], with tx, ty and tz being the first, second and third translation-value parameters respectively.

value.name: translateX()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the X direction.

value.name: translateY()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Y direction.

value.name: translateZ()
value.desc: Specifies a translation by the given amount in the Z direction. Note that percentage values are not allowed in the translateZ translation-value, and if present are evaluated as 0.

entry.name: -webkit-transform-origin
entry.desc: Establishes the origin of transformation for an element.

entry.name: -webkit-transform-origin-x
entry.desc: The x coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -webkit-transform-origin-y
entry.desc: The y coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -webkit-transform-origin-z
entry.desc: The z coordinate of the origin for transforms applied to an element with respect to its border box.

entry.name: -webkit-transform-style
entry.desc: Defines how nested elements are rendered in 3D space.

value.name: flat
value.desc: All children of this element are rendered flattened into the 2D plane of the element.

value.name: preserve-3d
value.desc: Flattening is not performed, so children maintain their position in 3D space.

entry.name: -webkit-transition
entry.desc: Shorthand property combines four of the transition properties into a single property.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -webkit-transition-delay
entry.desc: Defines when the transition will start. It allows a transition to begin execution some period of time from when it is applied.

entry.name: -webkit-transition-duration
entry.desc: Specifies how long the transition from the old value to the new value should take.

entry.name: -webkit-transition-property
entry.desc: Specifies the name of the CSS property to which the transition is applied.

value.name: all
value.desc: Every property that is able to undergo a transition will do so.

value.name: none
value.desc: No property will transition.

entry.name: -webkit-transition-timing-function
entry.desc: Describes how the intermediate values used during a transition will be calculated.

entry.name: -webkit-user-modify
entry.desc: Determines whether a user can edit the content of an element.

entry.name: -webkit-user-select
entry.desc: Controls the appearance of selection.

entry.name: white-space
entry.desc: Shorthand property for the 'white-space-collapsing' and 'text-wrap' properties.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'collapse' and 'text-wrap' to 'normal'.

value.name: nowrap
value.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'collapse' and 'text-wrap' to 'none'.

value.name: pre
value.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'preserve' and 'text-wrap' to 'none'.

value.name: pre-line
value.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'preserve-breaks' and 'text-wrap' to 'normal'.

value.name: pre-wrap
value.desc: Sets 'white-space-collapsing' to 'preserve' and 'text-wrap' to 'normal'.

value.name: pre-wrap-auto
value.desc: Preserves white space and allows wrapping. However, some of the behavior is made UA dependent to allow matching platform conventions.

entry.name: widows
entry.desc: Specifies the minimum number of line boxes of a block container that must be left in a fragment after a break.

entry.name: width
entry.desc: Specifies the width of the content area, padding area or border area (depending on 'box-sizing') of certain boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The width depends on the values of other properties.

value.name: fill
value.desc: Use the fill-available inline size or fill-available block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: fit-content
value.desc: Use the fit-content inline size or fit-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: max-content
value.desc: Use the max-content inline size or max-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

value.name: min-content
value.desc: Use the min-content inline size or min-content block size, as appropriate to the writing mode.

entry.name: will-change
entry.desc: Provides a rendering hint to the user agent, stating what kinds of changes the author expects to perform on the element.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Expresses no particular intent.

value.name: contents
value.desc: Indicates that the author expects to animate or change something about the element’s contents in the near future.

value.name: scroll-position
value.desc: Indicates that the author expects to animate or change the scroll position of the element in the near future.

entry.name: word-break
entry.desc: Specifies line break opportunities for non-CJK scripts.

value.name: break-all
value.desc: Lines may break between any two grapheme clusters for non-CJK scripts.

value.name: keep-all
value.desc: Block characters can no longer create implied break points.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Breaks non-CJK scripts according to their own rules.

entry.name: word-spacing
entry.desc: Specifies additional spacing between “words”.

value.name: normal
value.desc: No additional spacing is applied. Computes to zero.

entry.name: word-wrap
entry.desc: Specifies whether the UA may break within a word to prevent overflow when an otherwise-unbreakable string is too long to fit.

value.name: break-word
value.desc: An otherwise unbreakable sequence of characters may be broken at an arbitrary point if there are no otherwise-acceptable break points in the line.

value.name: normal
value.desc: Lines may break only at allowed break points.

entry.name: wrap-after
entry.desc: Specifies modifications to break opportunities in line breaking (and flex line breaking.)

value.name: auto
value.desc: Lines may break at allowed break points before and after the box, as determined by the line-breaking rules in effect.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Line breaking is suppressed immediately before/after the box: the UA may only break there if there are no other valid break points in the line. If the text breaks, line-breaking restrictions are honored as for 'auto'.

value.name: avoid-line
value.desc: Same as 'avoid', but only for line breaks.

value.name: avoid-flex
value.desc: Same as 'avoid', but only for flex line breaks.

value.name: line
value.desc: Force a line break immediately before/after the box if box is an inline-level box.

value.name: flex
value.desc: Force a flex line break immediately before/after the box if the box is a flex item in a multi-line flex container.

entry.name: wrap-before
entry.desc: Specifies modifications to break opportunities in line breaking (and flex line breaking.)

value.name: auto
value.desc: Lines may break at allowed break points before and after the box, as determined by the line-breaking rules in effect.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Line breaking is suppressed immediately before/after the box: the UA may only break there if there are no other valid break points in the line. If the text breaks, line-breaking restrictions are honored as for 'auto'.

value.name: avoid-line
value.desc: Same as 'avoid', but only for line breaks.

value.name: avoid-flex
value.desc: Same as 'avoid', but only for flex line breaks.

value.name: line
value.desc: Force a line break immediately before/after the box if box is an inline-level box.

value.name: flex
value.desc: Force a flex line break immediately before/after the box if the box is a flex item in a multi-line flex container.

entry.name: wrap-flow
entry.desc: An element becomes an exclusion when its 'wrap-flow' property has a computed value other than 'auto'.

value.name: auto
value.desc: For floats an exclusion is created, for all other elements an exclusion is not created.

value.name: both
value.desc: Inline flow content can flow on all sides of the exclusion.

value.name: clear
value.desc: Inline flow content can only wrap on top and bottom of the exclusion and must leave the areas to the start and end edges of the exclusion box empty.

value.name: end
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the end side of the exclusion area but must leave the area to the start edge of the exclusion area empty.

value.name: maximum
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the side of the exclusion with the largest available space for the given line, and must leave the other side of the exclusion empty.

value.name: minimum
value.desc: Inline flow content can flow around the edge of the exclusion with the smallest available space within the flow content’s containing block, and must leave the other edge of the exclusion empty.

value.name: start
value.desc: Inline flow content can wrap on the start edge of the exclusion area but must leave the area to end edge of the exclusion area empty.

entry.name: wrap-inside
entry.desc: Specifies line breaking within boxes.

value.name: auto
value.desc: Lines may break at allowed break points within the box, as determined by the line-breaking rules in effect.

value.name: avoid
value.desc: Line breaking is suppressed within the box: the UA may only break within the box if there are no other valid break points in the line. If the text breaks, line-breaking restrictions are honored as for 'auto'.

entry.name: wrap-through
entry.desc: Specifies if an element inherits its parent wrapping context. In other words if it is subject to the exclusions defined outside the element.

value.name: none
value.desc: The exclusion element does not inherit its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendants are only subject to exclusion shapes defined inside the element.

value.name: wrap
value.desc: The exclusion element inherits its parent node's wrapping context. Its descendant inline content wraps around exclusions defined outside the element.

entry.name: writing-mode
entry.desc: This is a shorthand property for both 'direction' and 'block-progression'.

value.name: horizontal-tb
value.desc: Top-to-bottom block flow direction. The writing mode is horizontal.

value.name: sideways-lr
value.desc: Left-to-right block flow direction. The writing mode is vertical, while the typographic mode is horizontal.

value.name: sideways-rl
value.desc: Right-to-left block flow direction. The writing mode is vertical, while the typographic mode is horizontal.

value.name: vertical-lr
value.desc: Left-to-right block flow direction. The writing mode is vertical.

value.name: vertical-rl
value.desc: Right-to-left block flow direction. The writing mode is vertical.

entry.name: x
entry.desc: Describes the horizontal coordinate of the position of the element.

entry.name: y
entry.desc: Describes the vertical coordinate of the position of the element.

entry.name: z-index
entry.desc: For a positioned box, the 'z-index' property specifies the stack level of the box in the current stacking context and whether the box establishes a local stacking context.

value.name: auto
value.desc: The stack level of the generated box in the current stacking context is 0. The box does not establish a new stacking context unless it is the root element.

entry.name: zoom
entry.desc: Non-standard. Specifies the magnification scale of the object. See 'transform: scale()' for a standards-based alternative.
